description: The name of this street is an obvious choice, as many metalworking
shops are setup along both sides of the street.  Though not
necessarily the best smiths in Waterdeep, these are the most
prominent, as established families in the trade, or high ranking in
the guild of metalworkers.  In either case, their trade boots a high
value, and their location here ensures them a stable clientele.  In
return for this prominent location within the City of Spendors, each
smith donates a percentage of their profits to maintaining the look
and feel of this avenue; a pleasant walk amidst one of Waterdeep's
oldest established neighborhoods.  To the north operates one of
Waterdeep's most famous places: the Yawning Portal Inn.
20634.name: {wStr{8ee{wt {cof {WS{wm{8it{wh{Ws{x

description: The road continues east and west, opening to the north where a dark
alley looms.  To the west the street drops down to another pathway,
part stone and part wood.  These are the docks where much of
Waterdeep's sea commerce flourishes, if under the guise of lower class
cogs.  Buildings here are old and leaning, many showing their age as
the sea mist cuts salty gashes into their surfaces.  Mostly
warehouses, these buildings still stand, which is all that is required
of them.  Dock Street begins to the west, while Fish Street continues
to the east.
20728.name: {cF{wis{ch {yStr{wee{yt{x

description: Small shacks and worn down brick houses and shops surround you.
The smell of smoke and rancid food is prevalent and seems that the
origination of it all comes from a smoke house just east of here.  The
loosely set cobblestones of Slut Street protrude from the road, making
it inhospitable for cart or carriage.  A rather inviting smell lingers
in the air, as aromatic smoke bellows from the Smokehouse to the east
of here.
20753.name: {RS{yl{cu{yt {wSt{8r{cee{wt{x

description: {x
Carts and wagons take over the road here as they fight for priority in
entering onto Julthoon street just east of here.  To the east lies the
Great Bazaar which also links to the many surrounding shops. Merchants
lurk everywhere trying to haggle anyone into buying their wares.  Many
take quite the interest while others try to squeeze by the area with a
most disgruntled facade indicative of their desire to be left alone. A
dazzling display of colors mark both the merchant garbs and their tiny
kiosk carts, which are used as devices to lure the unsuspecting into a
sale. A looming wall lies to the east of here marking a forbidden area.
20851.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x at {RJulthoon Street{x

description: {w
The northern gates of Waterdeep City rise just north of a cobblestoned
avenue that runs straight through the city. This is the High Road--the
long trade route that any seasoned merchant knows by heart. It is here,
grooved deep in places from centuries of heavy traffic, and frequently
repaired with smooth stones excavated along the nearby sea. Here along
the way intersects a smaller street, named Skull to the west and Immar
to the east, as indicated by a nearby marker post. Several individuals
can be seen wandering these streets, to more obscure parts of the city.{x
20954.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
The High Road turns here, veering away from several larger buildings to
the north and merging with the smaller River Street to the east.  A few
shops are set up along the sides of the road but otherwise this part of
the trades ward is unusually devoid of trade, at least trade which goes
on in plain sight.  Though two streets meet here, any likeness of River
Street from the east is completely swallowed by the mammoth that is the
High Road, as cart and foot traffic takes to marring away the evidence.{x
20782.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
The High Road continues through Waterdeep City--the extra wide street
seems large enough for a ship to traverse, should Waterdeep ever fall
victim to flooding. The prospect of this is slim, given that the city
has one of the most advanced sewage systems in all the realms.  Along
the road are set generous numbers of lamps kept well-lit by the light
man, whose only job it is to walk up and down the street lighting the
lamps until sunrise when he reverses his routine and extinguishes the
flames one by one.  Just off the road to the north is a big shop with
many weapons up in display. The massive sign reads Riautar's Weaponry.
20796.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
This wide, paved road is lined with majestic architecture ranging from
timber and wattle-and-daub to solid stone structures. These structures
are at least two stories high, and some are even three. Numerous signs
reach out extended from the buildings, attempting to catch the eyes of
passerbys and lure them into the shops that overpopulate the area.  To
the east is a modest shop with a gem-set shield hanging in the window;
a shield shop for adventurers. The High Road continues north and south.
20810.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {w
The likes of the High Road stretches on as far as the eye can see both
north and south of here. To the east of the road are many stone, brick
and marble mansions, each in competition with the other for the status
of being the tallest and most obscenely gaudy building in the ward. To
this end, many display wrought iron spires that appear as precariously
balanced as they are expensive to erect and maintain. Some manors have
extravagant entrances and lush gardens that display exotic plants from
all over the realms. Others are near overwhelmed with statues and rich
stonework balanced by incredible architectural feats beyond their time.{x
20951.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {DDark and silent, the alleys' shadows almost seem alive, twisting
and turning like a mist being pushed by a gentle wind.  No sounds
disrupt the silence here, and not a single ray of light reaches past
the buildings that make this alley so narrow.  A few piles of trash
lurk on the ground, questioning you if they carry anything beneath
them.  The alley veers north and west from here.  {x
20734.name: {gG{8ut All{gey{x

description: {x
The poor looking buildings in this ward of the city suggest this is one
of Waterdeep's low income districts, though the locals here appear much
friendlier than those found further north among the temples and villas.
The hustle and bustle of the High Road makes for an adventure in and of
itself, attracting many to its luster while driving away those who seek
a slower pace in their daily grind. The roadway is wide - allowing room
for four wagons side by side. The surface is worn, but even having been
fashioned from thick riverstone and dug deep into the ground. Along the
stretch of road are many shops and taverns where finding an interesting
bobble or a good drink is easy. To the east sits a small shop operating
from the floor level of an old building displaying woven items for sale.
20608.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: A faint smell of salted and seasoned meats wafts by your sense of smell
in the shop.  Almost directly in front of the door here is a glass counter
which holds a large variety of meats.  To the back of the room you can see
an entrance to a freezer room where hooks hang from the ceiling holding up
sides of beef or pork.
20833.name: {YBe{wl{Wmond{we{Yr's {rMeats{x

description: The name of this street is a bow to its solemn and inviting
stature, as well as the beauty that can be seen all about.  Some of
the most beautiful buildings can be seen here, mostly temples and
shrines, but the occasional mansion rises in competition with the
former.  A popular site in Waterdeep, the Sea Ward has often been
referred to as the temple district, and for many Waterdhavens, this is
a daily sight for their worship.  To the west, the wall is overgrown
with flowering vines such that scarcely a brick can be seen.
20930.name: {yS{wtr{8ee{yt {xof the {MS{gi{Gngi{gn{Mg {CDolphin{x

description: This wide, paved road is lined with majestic architecture of highly
erected, three story buildings.  Many of the buildings here hold
banners and crests of some sort, which shows that this area is of high
nobility and important social classes.  To the south is a noticebly
large house.  Waterdeep Way continues east and west, while to the
north Warrior's Way begins its long trek to the Sea Ward of the city.
20861.name: {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep {yWay{x

description: This wide, paved road cuts through the pinnacle of richness of much
of the homes in Waterdeep, aside from those found in and about the
palace grounds.  Second to these noble villas are those found in the
north ward, though all styles converge to here, as wonderous
structures surround the street, accented by ornate gables and rising
spires that clip the sun in a million rays of light.  Temples continue
this elegance in style, and the diversity of buildings here is
somewhat astounding.  Dolphin breaks here, leading out to Delzorin
Street just east of here.
20928.name: {MS{gi{Gngi{gn{Mg {CDolphin{x at {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: Many flowers and burning incense bowls line the Coffinmarch, which
can be described accurately as both a narrow street and a wide
walkway.  To the east the street leads to the gates of the City of the
Dead, where the dead are brought to their final burial place.  In
ancient times, other gates to the graveyard were utilized, as tombs
were constructed along the perimeter of the enclosure, but as space
became limited, individual graves were removed, and an intricate
network of tombs were constructed to accomidate an unlimited number of
the city's dead.
20828.name: {8The {RCo{rff{8inm{rar{Rch{x

description: {6This vast, large open space is the market center of the city.
Temporary carts and stalls enclose this area in a maze of shops and
stores that hustle and bustle to sell and buy as much as they can each
day and night.  Even special cast iron lamposts have been placed
randomly around the Bazaar to illuminate the area when the sun sets
and leaves from the sky.  {0
20917.name: {3Northeast Bazaar Market{0

description: A single candle flickers upon a small workbench in the far corner here.
Behind the counter sits a bored looking man scribbling with a quill on
a stack of parchments.  Surrounding him is a clutter of books, scrolls,
potions, and odd looking glass instruments. The same scene can be seen
throughout the room: many tables and benches cluttered with all manner
of oddities the majority of which are implements for beast tamers such
as whips, chains, leashes, and guiding rods.  Strangely, even a bright
light barely succeeds in penetrating the darkness where the faint glow
of cage bars peek out of dark corners.  Sounds of animals growling and
sniffing can be heard coming from a back room closed behind the keeper.{x
20693.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: {G[{Y@{G]{g================== {CWELCOME {cTO THE {YSAFEHAVEN {yINN {g=================={G[{Y@{G]
{g| |             {wWhere your safehaven is just a key away!             {g| |
| | {wThe {YSafehaven {yInn {xoffers comfortable rooms where your privacy is {g| |
| | {w"key"! Just request the room you wish to rent out by name and if {g| |
| | {wthat room is {Mavailable {wthe innkeeper will fetch the key for      {g| |
| | {wyou so you can buy it for the evening. If the room you want is   {g| |
| | {wcurrently not {Mavailable{w, try one of our many other rooms:        {g| |
{y
The insides of this inn is vast, decorated with many elegant statuettes and large
paintings that suggests the rooms here are very extravagant. The floors are lined
with wide runners lined in gold trim.  Wood and marble line everything, including
the big desk which sits just at the entrance.  Behind the desk, a tall man stands
waiting for clients to approach.  The main floor here, is surrounded on the north
side with a massive oak bar and barstools The wall behind the bar is dominated by
three big tuns of beer and smaller casks of wine. Four large support pillars hold
up the upper floors smaller booths lining the walls and serve to support the open
balconies. The fireplace hearth set within western wall is huge, a six-foot depth
opens through to a small kitchen where the food is cooked over the same fire with
the alluring aromas of warm stews and meats on spits filling the air of the lobby.
Just below the desk is a {Wsign {ywhich newcomers to the inn are invited to read over.{x
20687.name: {3The {#Safehaven {3Inn{0

description: Here, two streets converge, though one couldn't tell by looking as
everywhere lies scattered crates, barrels, bundles of netting and the
smell of rotting fish.  People go two and fro in all directions,
making this a precarious place to be.  Passengers disembark to the
west, and head east into the city, while crewmen converge from the
east and head to the west to their ships.  Sea captains seem to circle
about, surveying the area and perhaps searching for strong deckhands.
And then there is everyone else, a good chance them being the lawless
and pickpockets, as not a single city watch is in sight.  Net Street
runs to the east, while Dock Street runs to the north.
20715.name: {yN{we{yt{x at {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: {x
{B     +========{{|  {YF.A.S.T. Branch Locations  {B|}========+
{B   |  {CLOCATION        CONNECTING TO:     BRANCH MANAGER  {B|
{B   |  {WRassalantar     New Thalos         Andain          {B|
{B   |  {WNew Thalos      Waterdeep City     Jacob           {B|
{B   |        {R***{GNEW BRANCH LOCATIONS OPENING SOON{R***      {B|
The inside of this building has recently been remodeled, with
freshly stained wood flats lining the walls, and a fresh coat of
laquer on the red brick floor.  A long, oak counter stretches along
the northern side where man stands greeting clients.  Behind the
counter hangs a large {Wsign {xdetailing the various branch locations of
the Ferrier's Alliance.  A few seats and chairs have been placed about
the room, and on each table is a stack of booklets with information
about the alliance.
20690.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: Suldown Street continues east and west here, while to the north
begins Whaelgond Way--a small cutthrough connecting Suldown with other
parallel stretches to the north.  A few dark, one storied buildings
reside along the southern stretch of lots, which are narrow and
restricted by the impending walls of the City of the Dead.  The
graveyard, constructed centuries ago to combat the growing need for a
burial ground safe from heathen arts, is now a quiet park where
citizens can go, but city ordinance forbids strolling there after
hours.
20974.name: {rS{wuldow{rn {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: Salabar Street runs the short length between River Street and the
Court of the White Bull.  Considered the main means of reaching the
Court, this street is scarcely decorated with anything of interest.
No shops are setup along its length, and no obvious vendors, though
several streetwalking peddlers are around for those looking for
specialized merchandise.
20786.name: {gS{ca{8lab{ca{gr {rStreet{x

description: The timbers bend beneath the weight of constant traffic, offering
up a precarious scenario whereby innocent bystanders break through the
boardwalk down into the depths below.  A scenario quite possible as
much of the wood from which the docks were built is now weathered and
disintegrating, as the sea licks mercilessly at it.  Along the wide
stretch of docks, there are a few sights, such as the many warehouses,
the countless rows of dock and the many sea vessels that sit just feet
away in the harbor.  Many of the boats are makeshift residences, as
those who have vowed their lives to the sea know no other way to live.
20724.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: Delzorin curves an S as it meanders through the densely populated
temple district.  Lavish temples lie scattered about, some built
before this street was established.  Each follows its own unique
architectural style, and many sects established throughout the realms
model their churches after these built in the City of Splendors.  The
street itself does not match any single temple style, but it does
match the feeling of reverence, paved here in dark onyx, which is
cleaned and polished daily by the order of thralls.
20945.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: The street is elegantly paved with straight cleaved stones that
give off an alluring luster which makes the Street of Smiths something
of legend among Waterdhavens.  Maintained by contract from the guild
of thralls and street sweeps, this street is under special contract
which requires thrice monthly a thorough scrubdown of each stone,
followed by a coating of fresh, hot wax provided by the guild of
lamplighters.  While making the streets somewhat unstable, the
roughened texture masoned into the stones provides adequate traction
while maintaining the pleasant shine.
20635.name: {wStr{8ee{wt {cof {WS{wm{8it{wh{Ws{x

description: {x
The High Road continues through the city, connecting the northern and
southern roads on both ends of Waterdeep which define one of the most
important trade veins of this part of the realms. So important is the
Trade Way-High Road trade route that Waterdeep has enacted active and
aggressive patrols along much of the close lying lengths. Bandits and
would be con men are discouraged from their illicit activities within
the city limits. Instead many choose to conduct business just off the
beaten path, or in dark alleys were few guards patrol. Crime is still
predominant in Waterdeep, though many consider it healthy to commerce.
20852.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
The High Road passes through the South Ward which lies south of here as
a long stretch of mostly residential buildings.  This locale represents
much of the northern half of the citizens ward so named as the majority
of middle and lower class Waterdhavians reside here.  The neighborhoods
are bustling yet peaceful, fast paced yet inviting and perhaps the only
place in all of Waterdeep where this feeling can be had. Most buildings
here are wood and stone - the most common building material to be found
in Waterdeep though emphasis is placed here on functionality, resulting
in many plain squarish buildings standing one after another equidistant
from the street. Here along the High Road, there is much to see ranging
from the many shops and services, to the locals in their daily pursuits.{x
20614.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: A small fireplace set in the east wall of this shop gives off a
warm glow that illuminates the room here.  An old woman resting in an
antique rocking chair by th fire is cradling herself back and forth as
she weaves some type of wool shirt.  Along the floor around her, and
adorning the walls and tables as well are piles of knitting, and
weaving fabrics for all sorts of occasions.  Nothing else is present
in this shop, except for an old wooden door that leads to the weaver's
private chambers.
20691.name: {8Ne{yl{gka{yu{8sh{x the {yW{ge{yav{ge{yr{x

description: This long road is made out of pure black stone cut into 3 by 3
squares and fit snuggly together almost looking as one long slab of
stone trailing across from east to west.  The building structures here
are large, two story buildings - some made of stone, others made out
of expensive wood.  The sidewalks of this street is beautifully
decorated with plants everywhere, and some even hang from the outside
of people's windows.  The area here is peacefully quiet and away from
all the traffic commonly seen in most of waterdeep.  The avenue opens
widely to the east, into a rich and lavish garden full of interesting
things.
20962.name: {WSk{8u{Wlls {wS{8treet{x at the {BH{Ye{Wro{Ye{Bs' {GG{ga{yrd{ge{yn{x

description: {x
Along the road travel all manner of person, beast and baggage. There is
an air of impatience about everyone, as their paths intermingle and pit
one against the other. To the north is a wide entranceway adorned in an
elaborate gold wreath and two golden unicorn busts on each of two large
doors.  The large sign which hangs out into the street designates it an
inn called the Unicorn's Horn.  Just to the west is a large open square
where many people converge and many things are happening. The buildings
along both sides of the street are littered with spectators watching in
interest all that goes on below. The High Road continues east and west.{x
20798.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: While north of here in the Sea Ward, the style is artistically
classical, the buildings here are decisively plain and simple.  A
mixture of visible stone and wood, and in some places, traditional
thatched roofs make up much of these structures.  The road here is
paved in coarse stones and dirt, packed firmly by the large crowds
that travel this area day and night.  Dust is always in the air,
except when heavy rain pounds it into mud.  Though somewhat less than
pleasant conditions, even the lowest class areas of Waterdeep offer
running water and clean sewage removal, making this truly a City of
Splendors.
20743.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: River Street continues its short stretch here, connecting the River
Gate to the east with the rest of the city to the west.  The River
Gate is one of the latter added entries into Waterdeep, as trade
routes opened up to river travel, there grew a need to move trade
traffic from the main gates, south and north, where congestion was
becoming an issue.  Mainly used by the ferrier traffic, the River Gate
is frequently congested with large carts, coaches, and beasts that
travel the short distance to the nearby warehouses along the north and
further into the Sea Ward.  This part of Waterdeep is characterized by
foul odors and unkept streets, which have over the years been
subjected to much heavy traffic.
20784.name: {cR{Ci{Wv{Ce{cr {BStreet{x

description: A short, almost unnoticeable road leads north into the inner
workings of what is called the Adventurer's ward.  This area attracts
many adventurers, veteran or would be, for sharing in stories and
prospects of exciting new opportunities.  A large building rises
further north, while to the south runs the Coach Street, which is
never short of a coach speeding by.
20672.name: {MK{me{rr{8ri{rg{ma{Mn's {BCourt{x

description: {x
You enter a wide square, more aptly a circle, where the High Road veers
back north through the city and east across a brief spell in its trace.
This circle marks the center of the City of Spendors marked with sights
and sounds which please and overwhelm the senses. Just to the southwest
stands the majestic Waterdeep Castle, nestled within the highly rumored
Undermountain.  The streets are alive with trade as wagons and carts of
all sorts roll by you all heading to and fro the great market northwest
of here.  Streets and avenues continue into all four directions leading
out into the City of Splendors. A large statue stands about a fountain.
20802.name: The {BC{mi{Mrc{ml{Be{x of {BWa{bt{8e{wr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
The wide, bustling road known as the High Road traverses Waterdeep City
east and west here.  To the north is a narrow street, almost too narrow
for conventional cart and horse traffic. Very few people are seen going
in its direction, and it seems as if some almost try to avoid it. A big
wooden sign hangs from the corner of a building noting this side street
as Sleepers Walk - one of the streets leading into the City of the Dead.{x
20787.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: Swirls of dust gather in shallow alleyways as people trod across
the dirt road in search of their destination.  There is very little
remarkable about this part of the city, a bustling ward with a diverse
crowd, and poorly kept by the city.  Trash line the gutters, which are
hardly effective during rain, as most are full of mud washed from the
unpaved streets.  The buildings sink inward, leaning into the streets
in places where the foundation has fallen, and yet most are still
being used for business, storage, and even apartment homes.  Housing
here is very affordable, oftentimes only a few gold pieces a night,
though accomidations are less than hospitable, so only the brave or
desperate need seek shelter here.  Snail Street continues north and
south, passing a long row of warehouses to the west.
20749.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: Several storefronts open up in this part of Net Street, where the
last of well to do citizens go to shop, and the first place visitors
see upon disembarking from port.  Further west along the harbor
stretch, few shops are found, as the lots hold more profit utilized as
storage to fuel Waterdeep's vast trade industry.  The buildings here
are in grave disarray, old and seemingly ready to topple over, yet
they are still utilized until the day when they give in.  This is
Waterdeep's economically depressed ward, commonly referred to as the
Lawless Lots.  Sightseers are not welcome here, but money is, so a
compromise is often reached between them.  Net Street continues east
and west.  To the south is a small general store.
20709.name: {yN{we{yt {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: Just to the west, the sea looms, bringing in the smells and sounds
of the harbor.  Many tall buildings overlook the vantage above the
trollwall, where the nonstop sea traffic offers a show any time day or
night.  Just to the east, the great colliseum of Waterdeep holds the
area's attention, where warriors from all over the realms come to test
their skill.  Julthoon serves as a dividing line between two wards of
the city: the Castle ward to the south and the Sea ward to the north,
though from here little seems different on one side of the street or
another.  South, the palace and government buildings give rise to
guildhalls and temples, cathedrals and wizard's towers, though the
same lavish architectures still remain.
20857.name: {RJulthoon Street{x

description: This open square marks the intersection of two main streets: Coach
and the Way of the Dragon.  To the west begins Net Street and the way
to the harbor, where much of Waterdeep's working class is employed.
The Way of the Dragon, cutting north to south, marks the dividing line
between the Southern and Dock Wards, and for most Waterdhavens it
represents the dividing line of the middle and lower class.  Coach
Street merges almost exclusively northward onto Dragon, cleaving the
northeast corner of the square into a broad arc, where scarcely a
sidewalk exists anymore.  The storefronts here dwindle, as crime tends
to run rampant in these parts, making it a difficult place to turn a
profit.
20644.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: A very strong mixture of odors, both pleasant and overwhelming, dominate
this small shop of common and rare spices.  The owner of the shop seems to
have been quite picky in sorting the spices out as well since each one is
labeled accordingly from where the spice comes from, along with their rarity
and price.
20817.name: The {gH{couse {xof {CF{cine {rS{yp{ci{8c{ye{rs{x

description: Net Street opens out onto the boardwalk, as the great Deepwater
Harbor stretches across the east, littered with vertical lines
representing the masts of countless seafaring vessels.  The harbor
begins to the south and runs northward, along another street which
starts just west of here.  Most all buildings here are storehouses,
with a few businesses set up to cater to sailors and the repair of
vessels.  The street itself is a mixture of wood and packed dirt, a
few stones scattered about to ease the wear, though the years have
taken their toll as deep ruts dig their way into the ground.  People
are everywhere, most segregating into two flows: one going toward the
harbor and the other away.  Net Street continues east of here, and
west it intersects with Dock Street.
20714.name: {yN{we{yt {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: The dock boardwalk creeks beneath the weight of foot traffic and
from the tossing winds of the ocean to the south and west of here.
Just a ways out into the ocean can be seen the harbor walls emerged
from within the sea of swords, and the tower of Deepwatch Isle atop
them.  The warehouses and ship supply buildings along the boardwalk
here are weathered away from the wind.  Salt collects in the cracks
and wedges of the stone and wooden buildings eating away at their
strength to hold up their roof.
20719.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: {w
The smooth cobblestone avenue gets as much care as it does use judging
by its quality. In several places new lighter-colored stones have been
added to repair the damage set on from continual use. Along both sides
of the High Road stretch many brick and wood buildings unlike anywhere
else in the region, as brick is an expensive material to build with in
most parts. Many of these buildings are manor houses with their ornate
eaves and lush garden gateways many accented with noble lords in front
garbed in brightly colored robes over pale white skin. Many stand idle
as their gardeners and servants tend to the garden and walk about them.{x
20955.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: This street would be easily missed if one was not looking for it.
The surface is in disarray, as upturned cobblestones are coarsely
reset and packed with loose gravel and dirt.  Several lamps line the
street, but are either nonfunctioning, or uncontracted by the
lamplighters, such that this street is always dark.  To the east runs
the prominent street known as the Way of the Dragon, while to the
west, Slut Street continues into unknown parts.
20710.name: {RS{yl{cu{yt {wSt{8r{cee{wt{x

description: Diamond Street is a quaint stretch of road, snaking through the
heart of the temple district.  Its namesake has been secured through
clever architectural references to diamonds in many forms, including
the diamond cut and beveled paving stones and stone walls which repeat
a diamond pattern motif.  The temples are dense here, as each seems to
be trying to one up the other, biding for the attention of would be
worshippers to draw more power to their gods, and laden their donation
jars.  Still, few places elsewhere in the realms gives you more sight
and sound to take in for your platinum than here.
20615.name: {WD{Yi{xa{Wm{Yo{xn{Wd {YS{xt{Wr{Ye{xe{Wt{x

description: Whaelgond Way runs north and south, through several smaller villas
that lie between lots which open out onto main stretches of road.
Here one can see an interesting site.  The smaller villas which open
out to Whaelgond are built on small lots, perhaps partitioned off from
the gardens of the larger villas and sold or given to those who
desperately wished to live among the most powerful denizens of
Waterdeep.  Barring the availability of space, or the great price to
buy out current tenants, this for some was the only way to be here.
The small villas are built tall, but narrow, and from the front look
just as lavish as those that lie elsewhere.
20801.name: {yWh{Yae{yl{8gond {YW{yay{x

description: {8Oddly enough, after seeing how lavishly pronounced the rest of this
tower is, this room is complete bare..  {0
20925.name: {5Bedroom{0

description: This wide intersection marks the crossroads of Snail Street and
Soothsayer's Way.  Snail to the north leads to the Circle of
Waterdeep, and to the south meanders through the Castle Ward and into
the Dock Ward.  East and west runs Soothsayer, named by the ancient
fortune tellers of the royal court of Waterdeep who used this avenue
to deliver the daily tidings to the king and queen.  To the east,
Soothsayer ends at the Way of the Dragon, while to the west the avenue
expands to the royal walk leading to the castle.  From here Castle
Waterdeep can be seen atop the mountain, overlooking the city in all
her majesty.
20762.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x at {mS{Moo{mths{Ma{myer's {BW{bay{x

description: This avenue was first built to accomidate the funeral processions
which took the city's dead to the local graveyard, known formally
today as the City of the Dead.  Its purpose is still such, though much
of the avenue is devoted to dignified processionary images of watchful
guards and symbols, though purposely devoid of any permanent religious
imagery.  Several small vessels line the walkway, where fresh flowers
are placed for every funeral, which can accomidate as many as 50 dead
in a single procession.
20829.name: {8The {RCo{rff{8inm{rar{Rch{x

description: Just east of the bustling High Road lies the narrow, quiet stretch
known as Immar Street.  On either side of the street are extravagant
villas--the homes of Waterdeep's nobility, with their impressive, if
not gaudy, spires, decorative balconies, and intricate stonework,
these structures delight the senses, and spark a sense of intrigue.
Curiosity is only fueled by the tall walls which block in each home,
maintaining the residence privacy while offering but a glimpse at
their insides.  Along the road are set baskets for the couriers, who
do very well for themselves here in the noble district.
20755.name: {8Immar {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: This short and narrow alley resides between two tall stone
structures and thus shuns out all possibilities of any light reaching
in.  The ground is lightly scattered with gravel and mounds of trash
that have probably built up over the years.
20897.name: {8Watchrun {rAlley{x

description: The street curves west and north as it meets with a large temple
complex directly in front.  A common occurrence in the Sea Ward: roads
that veer sharply about large buildings of which staked claim to the
location long before it was a fashionable place to walk.  The traffic
is moderate, but lacks the hustle and bustle of the trade roads,
taking on an almost leisurely quality.
20636.name: {WD{Yi{xa{Wm{Yo{xn{Wd {YS{xt{Wr{Ye{xe{Wt{x

description: {6This vast, large open space is the market center of the city.
Temporary carts and stalls enclose this area in a maze of shops and
stores that hustle and bustle to sell and buy as much as they can each
day and night.  Even special cast iron lamposts have been placed
randomly around the Bazaar, to keep the haggling going well into the
twilight hours.  Warrior's Way begins to take shape south of here,
leading away from all the bustle down to the southern wards of
Waterdeep.  {x
20886.name: {3Southern Bazaar Market{0

description: The street begins a gradual climb upwards along a slope, as the
base of Mount Waterdeep protrudes far into the city.  A few of the
more prominent buildings here are terraced on level ground, excavated
from the sloping mountain base, but for those less established
structures, there's is an architecure unique to the plot they reside.
Most are old cathedral-like buildings, many still temples of worship,
while others have long been converted to other more mundane places,
such as government owned housing and meeting rooms for lesser
established guilds.  To the northwest rises a narrow, black tower,
reminiscent of an ebony stick, stuck in the ground with a can about
its base.  Directly south of here is an elegant temple, with a
brightly painted rayed sun upon the archway.  The temple of Lathander.
20910.name: {!Julthoon Street{0

description: Upon entering this beautifully designed shop, your sense of smell is
immediately overwhelmed by the many exotic perfumes that fill the shelves of
bottles in this store.  Bottles of all sorts, sizes, and colors can been
gazed upon in every direction - each one being imports from somewhere
throughout the realms.
20774.name: The {RH{rouse {xof {YP{yrid{Ye {MP{mer{Mfu{mme{Ms{x

description: This oddly shaped shop has the distinct smell of freshly brewed ale
and a hint of vineyard grapes.  The shop is very narrow but makes up
for it with its long aisles of numerous wines and ales of all shapes
and sizes.  Following the aisles of spirit racks is a large wooden
brewery at the back of the store where during the day and even night,
the owners are making freshly brewed ale to keep up with the large
demand of the flourishing taverns in the city.  Most people would
consider this shop a normal warehouse supplier, but every now and then
they sell some of their own products - and at amazingly low prices.
20694.name: {yHouse {xof {GG{goo{Gd {MS{ypi{wr{yit{Ms{x

description: Coach Street runs east and west, through much of the south part of
Waterdeep.  The coaches run this route, coming from the stables to the
east and spreading out throughout the city.  A gray blockhouse sits to
the south, bellowing smoke from windows and openings as an audible
clanking sound echoes between storefronts.  West leads out into a
chaotic intersection where much of the coaches merge onto the High
Road.
20679.name: {BC{boa{Bch Str{bee{Bt{x

description: This old warehouse seems to be the supply room for the tavern just east
of here.  Cluttering, and taking up most of the space here are crates of
food, large cheese wheels, and many many barrels of wine, ale and other
liquids.
20922.name: Old Warehouse

description: Several rows of open front shops spill out onto the wide sidewalks
as many of Waterdeep's prominent craftsmen show off their services and
goods.  Renoun for housing some of the most skilled craftsmen in the
region, the Street of Smiths district is about as high profile as a
working class neighborhood can get.  Not all are well regarded
however, as money will establish anyone here just as much, if not more
than skill will, and many skillful smiths decline to live here due to
its elitist status.  The street continues east and west.
20632.name: {wStr{8ee{wt {cof {WS{wm{8it{wh{Ws{x

description: The beautiful villas enclose this wide circle as Sulmor Street
gently intersects with Wheelgond to the north and south.  Each of
these homes are very old, and lavishly decorated, with tall iron gates
and front gardens that take up near as much space as the homes
themselves.  Only in the North Ward would such an obscene waste of
precious space be tolerated, though here if one is a noble, near
anything is tolerated.
20976.name: {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x at {yWh{Yae{yl{8gond {YW{yay{x

description: {6This vast, large open space is the market center of the city.
Temporary carts and stalls enclose this area in a maze of shops and
stores that hustle and bustle to sell and buy as much as they can each
day and night.  Even special cast iron lamposts have been placed
randomly around the Bazaar to illuminate the area when the sun sets
and leaves from the sky.  {0
20885.name: {3Southwest Bazaar Market{0

description: The decrepit condition of the road is obvious: slabs of once
mortared stone jut up in places, as in others coarse dirt and rocks
sit packed into the earth.  Large pools of water gather in low places,
as streaks of mud draw lines with the flow of traffic.  Buildings lean
this way and that, as their stone and wood structures fight to keep
them upright.  The smell of the sea industry saturates the air in
salty, fishy smells that one has to be accustomed to before it becomes
passing.  People who pass do so without concern of bumping into one
another, and all around there seems to be lacking the spark of li
countless droves continue about their daily grind.  Snail street
continues north and east of here.
20745.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: Though the Mystrans are more solitary in there religious practices, many
still love to come to this empowered room to listen to the highpriests speak
as the mouths of the true spell.  A truly amazing temple, ancient artifacts
of old created by the very goddess herself decorate the walls.  Busts of
Mystra's seven daughters and of various other Mystran chosen sit upon
granite pedestals as faerie fire makes them glow in righteous power.  Very
Magnificent indeed only the ignorant could not feel the very power radiate
in this room.
20987.name: {6C{&h{3ur{&c{6h {&of the {6E{&ve{6r {6M{&y{3ste{&r{6y{0

description: {cThe bazaar continues well into the southern half of the open market
center of Waterdeep.  Many stalls are setup in makeshift aisles,
making it difficult to find one's way through the winding maze they
have created.  Here, spots are more plentiful, as this part receives
less foottraffic than the others, being farther from the main stretch
of road.  Here two, there are fewer patrols, and danger is somewhat
more likely in this area than elsewhere.  {x
20887.name: {3Southeast Bazaar Market{0

description: Here the weeping maiden has wept.  Here painful tears and intensity can
be shown by the pitted scars left on this here stone.  Remember to forgive
thy enemies and allies, and know that war is not worth to make a woman weep
tears such as these.
This large stone upon closer inspection looks naturally cut by nature to
be used as a chair.  Upon the left side of the chair-stone are eight holes
burned deep into the core of the rock.  Only a substance such as acid
could do such a thing.  A small inscription has been carved into the base of
the stone.
The street is narrow and large brick buildings tower above,
obscuring the sky.  A large stone juts out from against the west walls
of the brick buildings here and demands the attention of those who
pass by it.  The stone's placement is odd and begs the question of its
purpose.  The road continues north and south while to the east, a
large open area can be seen full of people.
20661.name: {cW{Cee{cping {WM{wa{yide{wn{W's {GR{gun{x

description: This wide, paved road is lined with majestic architecture of highly
erected, three story buildings.  Many of the buildings here hold banners and
crests of some sort, which shows that this area is of high nobility and
important social classes.  Just a ways west can be seen a large palace, and
to the north is an odd looking tower - abandoned and dark - that for some
reason, no citizens seem to populate near.
20864.name: {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep {yWay{x

description: By the looks of this shop, it obviously specializes in the making of
daggers, blades, and knives.  Blades of all shapes and sizes are displayed
throughtout the entire room, mounted on walls, set in glass display cases,
or merely on the wooden counter in the back where the owner does his
business.  There are two glass display on both east and west sides of the
shops, the east hold daggers and knives, while the west displays small
blades such as a shortsword.
20764.name: Whistling {8Blades{x

description: The crates here are tightly packed together.
This large building is obviously used for the shipperworkers' storage
since there are piles of rope and anchorage materials all scattered all
about.  A few big crates border the southern walls of the room which carry
tools and supplies for dock and ship work.
20773.name: {BS{ghippe{Br's {8S{wtorag{8e{rhouse{x

description: The Way of the Dragon continues through south Waterdeep, passing
several interesting shops and sites along the way.  The Southern Ward
is renoun for its hospitality and no frills take on big city life.
Much of Waterdeep's middle class resides in this ward, where wealth
comes second to merryment.  As such, one will find many bars and
entertainment venues here sure to keep a visiting adventurer
entertained.  The street is paved in carefully fitted stones, and is
well maintained by the city's guild of custodians.  To the south is a
leatherman shop.
20637.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: The street is paved in stone, and well maintained by the guilds who
do very well on city contracts.  On either side stand many examples of
beautiful architecture, mostly temples and shrines, but several of
them are noble homes.  For the well established f is their home.  Less
established nobles, or so called "new money" primarily reside east in
the North Ward.
20884.name: {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: You are in the center of a large oak tree.  Thick sturdy branches
entangle you, leaving merely a small pocket in which you stand.  The only
way out is climbing the branches down, but it is a steep, perilous, climb.
You doubt that you can make your way back into this alcove from the ground,
without the help of some magical aid.
You see a portal to the east glowing and swirling. You see Market Square
Of Westbridge on the other side.....
20704.name: {8Inside a Great Oak Tree{x

description: This brightly lit store sparkles and shines from the numerous gems and
jewelry that have been safely put onto display in locked glass cases.  The
whole store is very clean - almost to the point where dust is non existant.
To the south is a counter where business sales are dealt with, along with
some appraisal devices that have been set up to view different types of
gems.
20899.name: {2{@J{2e{@w{2e{@l{2s {$o{4f {#t{3h{#e {!L{1a{!n{1d{0

description: This cute little shop is full of trinkets - both useless and useful.  A
few toys are scattered among the tables here, and at the center there is
some rope other hiking gear on display along with a few other things.
20986.name: Selchoun's Sundries

description: This east west street cuts through several distinctly different
looking parts of the city.  Here, there are several plain two and
three story residential buildings, fashioned from red brick and timber
and displaying many windows along the street facing side.  These and
other apartments like it are where the majority of Waterdhavians live.
A few patches of green have been preserved, but otherwise there are
very few park like areas in this district.  A smell of sewage lingers
in the air, suggesting this area is densely populated.  The street
itself is in disarray, with deep ruts cut lengthwise from the
continuous coach traffic.  Here an old warehouse stands to the south,
while Coach Street continues east and west.
20677.name: {BC{boa{Bch Str{bee{Bt{x

description: Soft, smooth marble line this street, as marble temples adorned
with silken tapestries play upon the name of the Street of Silks.
Originally known for spawning the silk trade in Waterdeep, this area
has since grown from a bustling commercial district, to a reverent
temple ward, but the secular flare of adornment still remains.  Most
buildings here are older structures, as rain and the elements have
streaked and pitted the once smooth marble, though considerable time
and energy is spent maintaining the luster.  The city contractors
spend three weeks out of each year painting prominent buildings with
hot wax, to maintain a lasting gleam and protect surfaces from the
weather.  The Street of Silks continues north and south.
20878.name: The {mStr{Wee{mt of S{Wi{mlks{x

description: The Street of Silks gets its name from the silk trade which once
brought prominence to this small section of Waterdeep.  Today,
commerce moved further east, and this ward became a center for
religous worship.  Many elegant temples and shrines lie scattered
throughout, at almost every turn of the corner.  Buildings are lavish,
expensive, and represent some of the best that Waterdeep has to offer
in architecture.  To the west, a shrine devoted to Tyr rises tall and
narrow, its white marble stairs spilling out into the street.
20877.name: The {mStr{Wee{mt of S{Wi{mlks{x

description: Upon entering this large building, a must...  Almost ashy smell fills
your lungs.  The sounds of a forge and constant hammering can be heard in
the back room where all of the smithys work their hard labor.  Hanging on
the walls are numerous metal odds and ends used as household decorations.
On the east shelves are some buckets of nails, horseshoes, spikes and
needles.  On the west shelves are a few simple weapons like flails maces and
hammers.  In the center of the room is a small booth where selling, buying,
and trading goes on.  To the north is where the smithies work and lound
clangs of metal can be heard.  Also, a spiral stairway leads up from here to
the second floor.
20699.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: {y
{y    |{r                                `{y              {gby Zotiel{y       |
{x
{x
The road inclines gradually as it leads northward up the sloping fringe
of Mount Waterdeep towering near to the northwest. Here along the road
there are numerous shops offering everything from basic traveling needs
to exotic foods and customized services, all at competitive prices that
mark this part of many traveler's journey as a noteworthy stop on their
otherwise tedious routine. Here in particular operates a loud and rowdy
tavern just to the east, where many people group to get in. It seems a
plain building, with painted pane windows and a raised porchway, and in
need of renovation. A simple wooden sign hangs atop the entrance naming
this place as The Sword's Rest. The High Road continues north and south.{x
20618.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: This wide road is rather crude for most, though heavily traveled by
the thick stepping caravans of the city.  So traveled is this road,
that the city would rather have the caravans pack the dirt than bring
in masons to properly pave it in stone.  Dust rises as carts ride by,
and animal refuse litters the road, making it inhospitable for foot
travel.  The east opens up into a large courtyard, where many of the
caravans setup camp, and just to the west, the civil likes of the High
Road can be seen.
20628.name: {yCaravan {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: {x
This wide, paved road is lined with majestic architecture ranging from
timber and wattle-and-daub to solid stone structures. These structures
are at least two stories high, and some are even three. Numerous signs
reach out extended from the buildings, attempting to catch the eyes of
passerbys and lure them into the shops that overpopulate the area.  To
the south begins a long stretch of road known as the Way of the Dragon
while the main artery of the High Road continues east and west of here.{x
20795.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: Soothsayer's Way continues east and west.  Named for the
soothsayers who walk it even to this day, proclaiming the impending
doom of the city, this street has taken on a color and flare all its
own.  Now soothsayer, jester, and entertainer alike all share this
road, carefully watched by the city's guards.  This area is perhaps
the safest in all of Waterdeep, with the continuous foottraffic of
guards, sentries and the city watch going to and fro from their
central station near the castle gates.
20760.name: {mS{Moo{mths{Ma{myer's {BW{bay{x

description: This majestic street runs through some of the most popular sites in
the northern part of Waterdeep, from Fetlock Court just south of here,
to the Palace Grounds, the base of Mount Waterdeep, and through the
temple district.  Buildings are beautiful artforms here, fashioned
from marble and granite, and adorned in detailed relief carvings that
represent some of the finest masterworks in the city.  Beauty is
predominant here, as many of the temples exhibit pricy features meant
to lure followers within, and hopefully straight to the donation box.
The street continues north and south.
20876.name: The {mStr{Wee{mt of S{Wi{mlks{x

description: The small street known as Whaelgond runs north and south straight
through the middle of some of the wealthiest neighborhoods in all of
Waterdeep.  Here, the villas turn their backs to the street,
preferring to display their showy entryways to main stretches such as
Delzorin to the north, where most of the traffic passes.  To the west
is the side of a shop, which contrasts with the decorative features of
the homes, preferring function over form.  Yet even the modest of
shops here in the north ward is a castle compared to those seen
elsewhere in the city, especially in the likes of the dock ward.
20969.name: {yWh{Yae{yl{8gond {YW{yay{x

description: The street is part land, part boardwalk, as thick timbers pave the
otherwise precarious drop down to the sea.  Deep ruts have been gouged
out of the timbers, as carts and wagons have taken their toll on them.
The great Sea of Swords opens to the west, spanning as a mighty field
of deep blue, interrupted by a long stretch of sea wall encircling the
harbor.  Along the land side of the street are many buildings, mostly
storehouses and private facilities, offering no hospitality to
seafarers looking for a place to feel at home.  For them, Waterdeep
offers much in the way of enjoyment, though further within the Dock
Ward to the east.  The street continues along the harbor and the rows
upon rows of docks.  To the south, Dock Street merges with Net Street.
20716.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: {x
An endless river of carts, wagons, animals and people flows up and down
the High Road all hours day and night.  The banks of this river are the
countless rows of multi-storied buildings, here they are plain squarish
structures with shops on the lower levels and residential apartments on
the uppers. Here in the south ward of Waterdeep are mostly local places
which cater to travelers along the main road. The Waterdhavians who are
caretakers to these businesses are friendly folk, though the same can't
be said about the owners, who oftentimes are nobles living in the north
and sea wards, far from any of the hustle and bustle of people. Here is
where all the action is where anything can be bought, sold or traded in
a moment's barter and where good food and friends are just up the road.
20609.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
Just north of Waymoot, the great High Road through Waterdeep carries an
abundance of merchants, travellers, and Waterdhavian locals to numerous
places that are of high regard when referring to waterdeep. Here in the
South Ward, much of the land is occupied by residential buildings, most
are multi-storied wood and brick and always housing the maximum allowed
number of people, though it is well known that to avoid taxation, their
owners report no more than three quarters of the true number of tenants.
This has the effect of substantially underscoring census numbers making
the true population of the city a great deal more than what is declared.
The High Road continues north and south, while an old warehouse is east.
20696.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: This street is elegantly paved in marble, with some semiprecious
stone laid in discreet intervals, giving a nod from when this was one
of the most wealthiest districts in the city.  Still today, it remains
a high profile area, holding many religious shrines and temples, and
some of the most wealthy citizens in Waterdeep.  In that time too,
many powerful wizards settled here in daft stone cathedral like
buildings and more traditional towers, many of which survived the
countless arcane experimentation to stand here still today.  One such
tower lies up the ridge to the northwest--a narrow black form
resembling an ebony quarterstaff stuck upright in the dirt.
20882.name: The {mStr{Wee{mt of S{Wi{mlks{x

description: This long road is made out of pure black stone cut into 3 by 3 squares
and fit snuggly together almost looking as one long slab of stone trailing
across from east to west.  The building structures here are large, two story
buildings - some made of stone, others made out of expensive wood.  The
sidewalks of this street is beautifully decorated with plants everywhere,
and some even hang from the outside of people's windows.  The area here is
peacefully quiet and away from all the traffic commonly seen in most of
waterdeep.  A small shop to south holds many odd trinkets displayed through
the windows.
20961.name: {WSk{8u{Wlls {wS{8treet{x

description: This unclean, noisy, crowded, gravel-packed dirt road is the prime
example of what the dock area is all about.  There is a dim haze of
dust that lingers in the air from the dirt that gets kicked up from
all the people and wagons passing by.  The building structures are
mostly cheap timber, and many of the buildings are rotting and patched
with more wood to prevent them from falling into a pile of firewood.
Every now and then there is a stone structure seen looking as if its
purpose is to just hold all the shacks so that they don't collapse.
20744.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: Diamond street leads out from the city to the west gates and into
the city east where it eventually intersects with the High Road
through Waterdeep.  Along both sides of the street are many elegant
displays of architecture, from highly ornate gables to dizzyingly tall
spires, which decorate the homes of nobility.  Occasionally, there
stands a somewhat plain building, heavily constructed of stone and
iron, and capped with a tall tower which effortless rises above the
other homes nearby.  These are the towers of wizards, who on occasion
choose to reside here in Waterdeep's most lavish and elegant ward.
20933.name: {&D{#i{7a{&m{#o{7n{&d {#S{7t{&r{#e{7e{&t{0

description: {y
/|  /{WH D{y|
| /{WG A{y/
|/{WI O{y/
|{WH R{y/
< {WWay of the Dragon {y|=|   {WSouth Gate{y    >
{x
This wide intersection is the main crossing point of the two most
heavily used roads in all Waterdeep. To the north runs the famous
High Road, leading through some of the city's most visited sights.
To the west begins the Way of the Dragon, connecting the far west
part of the city. Of note here is a large signpost, floating with
no supports in the air.  Upon it is tacked arrows pointing in all
directions, indicating some of the most popular sites in the city.
20603.name: {GWaymoot{x

description: {x
The High Road runs to the west and south here as traffic moves itself
to these directions, whether that is where one wants to go.  Numerous
shops are setup along the road here, though strictly kept a few paces
back so as to not slow down the movement of traffic, much of which is
through the city rather than parts within.  To the far south, the sky
is dominated by a massive tower-like structure; a flat-topped pyramid
that seems to shine brightly with enchantment. Along the road here an
array of shops and vendors are setup, signifying this as being within
the trades ward.  An established butchery lies just east of the road.{x
20791.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: This north south run is called The Way of the Dragon, legened to
have come from an ancient dragon that once inhabited this area in and
around Mount Waterdeep.  Today, this avenue stands as a testament to
progress, displaying tall, multistoried buildings and all the modern
conveniences such as public trash barrels, underground sewage and
clean, running water.  A dichotomy of newly restored buildings and
old, neglected squats stand row to one alongside one another as the
street cuts down the belly of Waterdeep City.
20650.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: The street bends here, coming in close proximity with the north
trollwall, which can be seen through alleyways to the northeast of
here.  Nearly every building here is a home, a very large home in
fact, and most are blatantly showy, expressing form over function in
every facet.  Perhaps one building on every city block serves some
other function, be it a storage building, or the occasional shop,
catering to the basic needs of visitors and residence.  The shops do
not bar anyone from entering, but do expect money to be spent within,
and if you pay a visit, expect to pay a high price for even the most
basic of essentials.
20780.name: {8Immar {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: Suldown continues here, veering northeast as it follows a strict
border with the walls surrounding the City of the Dead to the south.
Here, the styles are clean and traditional: stone and iron makes up
much of the storefronts, while the simple structures between this
street and the dead city are nearly formless in design.  Few stores do
business along this stretch, preferring instead places where people
would actually enjoy stopping and letting go of a few coins.  Smaller
homes and apartments line the northern half of the street, entering
into the grander showcase of noble villas further northward.
20985.name: {rS{wuldow{rn {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: The crates here are tightly packed together.
This large building is obviously used for the shipperworkers' storage
since there are piles of rope and anchorage materials all scattered all
about.  A few big crates border the northern walls of the room which carry
tools and supplies for dock and ship work.
20771.name: {BS{ghippe{Br's {8S{wtorag{8e{rhouse{x

description: This curiousity shop is filled with lots of battle trophies and souvenirs
from Undermountain.  The shop is untidy, and ill-organized, but worth a look
to see the stuffed beholder hanging by the main counter.
20998.name: {@The Old Xoblob Shop{0

description: Buildings surround this dead end, and scarcely is there enough room
for carts and wagons to turn around.  The many people who gather on
the streets to shop makes it even more difficult to navigate.
Grocer's Lane ends here at the entrance to a rather wide alleyway,
which opens to the south.
20666.name: {gGrocer's Lane{x

description: An array of many types of weapons and shields adorn the walls mounted in
this nice, quaint looking shop.  At a second glance though, some of the
weapons seem to look worn as if used.  In fact, all of the items in the
store are of secondhand.
20850.name: {$The {8Riven{$ Shield Shop{0

description: The distinction between the meeting of two streets is blurred here
in this makeshift commons, as Saerdown Street runs southward, and
Immar northward.  Here, several of the homes lie staggered along the
road, some opening to the adjacent streets on the other side of the
block, but whichever end one looks at these villas, they remain
striking in their design.  Many display large spires which seem to
fight one another for the highest position, and most all are adorned
with ironwork and stonework representing among the highest quality
anywhere.  Just south of here begins the cliffwatch.
20970.name: {cSa{ye{rrd{yo{cwn {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: The street continues through the Southern Ward of Waterdeep,
passing by many multi-storied buildings which house people at the
upper floors and shops at the ground level.  Though modest in their
looks, the structures here are utilized to their fullest, with small
garden ledges built outside windows, ropes stretching across buildings
to hang clothes and send across messages to nearby neighbors, even
rooftop gardens built for the tenants to enjoy what little nature
remains among the city of stone.  Storefronts are decorated with
bright colors to attract people inside, though most shops here have
modest offerings.  To the north is a large store, seemingly empty.
20639.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: Piergeiron's palace west
20871.name: FREE ROOM

description: The street continues around a few larger buildings, meandering
gently as it cuts through the Southern Ward.  Just to the west, the
sounds of mooring bells can be heard, as large ships pull into the
largest harbor on the western coast.  The air is cool and crisp, with
a hint of a salty mist lingering.  The local Waterdhavens busy
themselves with all manner of distractions: sitting along the shaded
entrance to an apartment complex, or pruning a tiny garden within a
split barrel, and a few are too busy with their destinations to
consider much else but their stride.  The look of these buildings is
typical of a commoner class, as this Ward is known by few, but lived
in by many.
20641.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: This tavern is dark, smelly, and loud, which makes it an ideal
place to take in some culture.  Tables and chairs are made from
barrels and rope spools, keeping cost and comfort down.  The venue is
rather simple: ales, meats and plenty of it, while the clientel is
some of Waterdeep's finest working class, rough but friendly.  The
tavern building is a converted warehouse, which stretches north and
west of here, while to the south the way leads out to the Dock Street.
20767.name: The {yS{8a{wil{8o{yr's {WO{wwn{x

description: Grocer's Lane ends here in a wide cove, allowing for the safe
traversal of wagons and coaches whose destination ends here.  Numerous
shops take advantage of the popularity of this area known for its
shopping and open out to the lane.  To the east is a silversmith's
shop displaying many silver items, while to the south is a store
displaying a compass as it's mark.  Grocer's Lane continues westward.
20665.name: {gGrocer's Lane{x

description: {x
{r                         /  | {DvoV{r \{R^^{r/ {DVov{r |  \

You have stumbled into a peaceful, fragrant grove surrounded by
deep forest, and carpeted in thick, lush grass.  A waterfall cascades
from a rock ledge to the north, and empties into a quiet pool in which
many rainbow-colored fish feed.  Next to the pool a massive weeping
willow trails its long, sinuous fingers in the water.  Large
iridescent-blue fruit hang heavily from a silver-barked tree nestled
in boulders.  Sunlight streams through the thick canopy of trees,
spilling across the low, comfortable grass hassocks scattered about.
Exotic flowers of all shapes and sizes color the grove and send rich
perfume wafting throughout, while many-colored butterflies dance among
them.  A variety of wide-eyed rabbits, deer, and other creatures move
about, watching you inquisitively, yet unafraid.
20938.name: {GM{yie{8li{ykk{Gi{x'{gs {GG{grove{x

description: There are to be NO wagons, carts, or anything items that have wheels to
be allowed on this road!  Anyone defying this law will be stripped of their
possesions and fine for 10000 platinum!
Immar street continues east and west here, with the noble villas
lining both sides of the street.  Space is at a premium in Waterdeep
yet here is where one can get a glimpse at what it was like before
this was the case.  The homes are wide and tall, and many show off
large gardens, some larger than the grand foyers and dining halls
which many also house within.  Such a seeming waste of space is rarely
tolerated, though easily overlooked if one has money or is a member of
a powerful family.  Also the case, if your home happens to be several
hundred years old, then gardens and such are more easily overlooked.
20875.name: {8Immar {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: Dazzling crystal can be seen all about--danging from all sides of
the ceiling and every eave and overhang in sight.  Of note are the
many magnificent pendulum tears and most all of the bare wall space
which is covered in decorative mirrors especially appealing to the
wealthy nobles of this ward.  Several vibrant crystal balls sits along
the front counter.  The torches in this shop are so well placed as to
emblaze each item with fire of its own.
20984.name: The {cHouse {xof {WC{Mr{Cy{cs{Ct{Ma{Wl{x

description: The air here is slightly musty while the torch light hardly
illuminates the place.  Old tarnished metal objects decorate the walls
which have collected soot and dust from the numerous years of being on
display and rarely ever been touched.  Though this shop looks to be in
disrepair, the services provided by the smiths here are renoun
throughout the realms for getting a great many individuals out of
binds.  A small hatch at the back of the counter leads down into a
dark room.
20898.name: The {YGolden {WKey {cL{roc{ck{8smiths{x

description: Two large avenues intersect here, but the square remains modest,
lacking in the many gatherings and merchants which are characteristic
of others throughout the city.  This is due to the ordinance of the
district, that trade be regulated and large gatherings shunted, to
maintain peace and order in this old ward.  The noble houses rise up
on all sides, and here several large turrets from ancient towers hang
over into the intersection, shading the road from the sometimes
relentless sun.
20926.name: {MS{gi{Gngi{gn{Mg {CDolphin{x at {WD{Yi{wa{Wm{Yo{wn{Wd {YS{wt{Wr{Ye{we{Wt{x

description: This street is wider than many of the offshoot runs, though not as
wide as some of Waterdeep's main travel arteries.  The stones here are
wide flatstone, mined from the nearby river and seashore.  It is a
rugged stone, darker than river stone from other regions, and most are
very flat, offering strength, convenience, and a character all its
own.  Along both sides of the street, the grand villas of the north
ward stand.  Unlike most other homes in Waterdeep, these villas are
spacious.  Alleyways are scarce, as special provisions have allowed
the nobles to take over these for their own use.  Such uses include
gardens, courts, or just a place to put up a privacy wall, which one
will find plenty of here.
20964.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: Caravan Court opens to the east and south here, though there's
nothing much impressive about it.  A haze of dust hangs over this dirt
packed court, amidst a sordid crowd of drovers, beasts, wagons and
debauchery.  Cursing is a common sound to be heard over the groan of
pack animals, the perpetual stench of the assorted beasts of burden
lingering in the air.  Tall buildings crown the court, their backs
turned to the many underhanded dealings that goes on here and within
the shroud of the open stables.  The city watch makes a presence here,
though it is uncertain whether they too are in on much of the
uncounted profits made here each moment.  The Court continues
southeastward, while Caravan Street runs to the west.
20621.name: {yCaravan {YC{yourt{x

description: Delzorin Street ends here at a T-intersection, which opens in a
large circle.  A smaller street called Whaelgond runs north and south.
Here at the end of the street stands a great mansion, spanning
multiple city lots and rising several stories which are hard to count
due to the inconsistency of windows that are spaced about its odd
angles.  The mansion offers a direct line of sight down Delzorin for
its residence, as far as the temples of the sea ward far to the west
and beyond.  Across massive, closed gates and a lush garden walkway
sits a mansion shrouded in secrecy--just one of the many places of
intrigue here in the north ward of Waterdeep.
20968.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x at {yWh{Yae{yl{8gond {YW{yay{x

description: {x
True nobility can be seen all about as large mansions rise to enormous
heights mostly north east of here.  To the west lie staggered numerous
temples representing a myriad of religions and a tranquilty that can't
be matched elsewhere in the city.  It is easily glanced over that this
road represents a common division marker for the nobility of Waterdeep
and the remaining citizens of a lesser repute. The High Road continues
north and south while Delzorin Street intersects east and west of here.
20855.name: Intersection of {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x and {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: Tall buildings line the streets, representing some of the more
lavish architecture that can be found in the older Southern Ward of
the city.  The Way of the Dragon marks a dividing line between poverty
and starvation, with the Southern ward to the east and Dock ward to
the west.  The former is where most of Waterdeep's lower and middle
class citizens reside, while Dock ward houses much of the working
class and those who have no home to speak of.  The Way of the Dragon
continues north and south through the heart of the city while a small
alley merges with it from the west.
20651.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: {x
Here, three roads intersect though predominant among them runs the High
Road north and south. To the west runs a rather clean, inviting stretch
denoted as the Street of Smiths. Its surface is neatly paved and gleams
with a shine hardly made by accident. To the east is just the opposite:
a narrow dirt packed roadway, crowded with caravan traffic and the many
beasts of burden which come with the traders.  Unsurpassed by either is
the High Road with its thick, rugged stonework paving, artifically worn
with roughing marks as a courtesy to the carts and coaches who would in
their haste loose traction from the smooth weathering of stones beneath
a multitude of travelers and time.  Against this great road, few others
in Waterdeep can compare both in terms of its size and high use and the
attention spent in maintaning it as a prominent cut through of the city.
20617.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {r
A small, {gqu{raint, overgrown ga{wrden of r{roses have taken over t{mh{ris once
we{ml{rl kept {gc{rourtyard. T{mh{rorns {wand vines cre{rep up along the stone walls,
and have {gg{rone as far as bre{waking the stone {rdown b{my {rburrowing into it.
The whole {gco{rurtyard is so o{wvergrown that only {ra narrow pat{mh{rway break
to the t{mo{rwer {gi{rs usable. The rem{wainder of the old garde{rn is scattered
wi{mt{rh prickers {gan{rd we{me{rds. Down the {wpath can be seen a large {rcrumbl{mi{rng
tower, leaning {ga{rnd swaying as if it {wis about to fall completely {rover.{x
20683.name: {yT{8ow{wer {cCour{wty{8ar{yd{x

description: Weeping Maiden's Run is accented by large, jagged bricks that pave
the road in uneven steps.  In places puddles gather, suggesting a
street in need of repair, or heavy use to pack the foundation.  Here
at the start of the road is embedded a large stone, easily noticeable
from a distance.  Upon it is carved the words "Adventurer's Ward" by
some amateur hand.  To the north, the look of the buildings take on a
cleaner, more modern style, while to the south and east, the
structures are classic wood and stone.  Toward the west is the main
road known as the way of the dragon, and east heads deeper into this
so called adventurer's ward.
20657.name: {cW{Cee{cping {WM{wa{yide{wn{W's {GR{gun{x

description: A smokey haze envelpos the air of this shop as does a salty smell of
cured and smoked meats and fish.  The walls and floor are disgustingly dirty
and worn away from the chemicals used here and lack of clean up after daily
smokings.  Far to the back are racks of meat and fish hanging by the ceiling
being treated so they may be dried and sold to the market and shops of
Waterdeep.
20905.name: {8The Smokehouse{0

description: The streets are quiet, as much of this part of the city is.  Lavish
villas sit along both sides of the roadway, their patterns broken on
occasion by a quaint patch of green and several large old trees.  This
part of the city is maintained very well, and crime is perhaps at its
lowest here, as there is rarely a moment between seeing one city watch
patrol and another.  Passerbys are extravagantly dressed in the garb
of nobility, and rarely do they bother to make eye contact, especially
with a stranger or one inclined at adventuring.
20868.name: {8Immar {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: The entrance of the House of Wonders is a legend that most in Faerun
cannot even imagine.  Beautiful tapestries of Mystran heroes adorns it's
fine wooden walls as mystical illusions made by the lady's dweomerkeepers
make them move in visage and feat.  An ancient jade mist dragon seems to fly
as it becomes the decorum of the roof carvings.  The hall is a moving
masterpiece of art and the mastery of magic.  To your south two ancient
doors with carvings of the lady in all her radiance covets the southern wall
of her church.
20981.name: {$En{7tra{$nce {$H{7al{$l{0

description: This huge warehouse is tightly stacked with heavy metal crates that equal
the size of 100 feet by 100 feet square each!  Locks and chains swing around
each crate hugging them closed for even extra security measures.  On each
metal crate is a signet marking that looks somewhat like a {#golden{0
crayfish.
20768.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: This large warehouse has been messily left and unkept.  Crates of
baskets, and in somplaces just baskets by themselves, have been pile atop
one another as if thrown together in one big heap It doesn't look as if
anyone could fine what they needed in here if they tried.
20835.name: An {8Old {yWa{wr{8eho{wu{yse{x

description: A dark road begins here, spanning east and west alongside the
Trollwall--the ancient stone wall built to fend off trolls in the
ancient time of Waterdeep's history.  Along with the feeling of dark
and emptyness, this road is quite literally dark: fashioned from large
squares of black stone, which have been rounded at the junctions from
many centuries of foot traffic.  Buildings line the southern edge, and
lie scattered at the north, squeezed between the road and the wall.
Many are homes belonging to Waterdeep's watch.  Skulls Street
continues westt, and just to the east the great High Road swallows it
up.
20956.name: {WSk{8u{Wlls {wS{8treet{x

description: {x
The crowd dispurses here in a torrent of confusion as two large streets
intersect. Going north south is the High Road which is the direction of
most of the traffic. Cutting through it east west is Coach Street which
is where fast moving coaches either merge into the High Road, or atempt
to cut through it. In either scenario, the lack of an enforced right of
way makes the scene rather chaotic. Several prominent buildings rise up
here at the corners, though it is unclear what purpose they serve. Rich
architecure accents each, with intricately detailed stonework that sets
a sharp contrast with the buildings along all directions away from them,
those being best described as plain but functional. To the east one can
see the River Gate entrance while the west leads to the harbor district.
North along the High Road continues deeper into Waterdeep and the south
ventures to the famed Waymoot square, and eventually to the South Gates.{x
20605.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x at {BC{boa{Bch Str{bee{Bt{x

description: The traffic here is a little heavier than the nearby streetways, as
Immar intersects with Whaelgond Way to the south.  Despite that, it is
not at all busy compared with the most of Waterdeep, as the north ward
is known for being relatively quiet and eventless.  If events did
happen, it would be hard to tell as near every home is accented with
high windows, or closed walls, or both.  A few shops have set up here,
as several people take to buying their essentials, rather than making
a trip to the bazaar.
20812.name: {8Immar {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: {y|                           {cTHE SP{COUTI{cNG FISH                            {y|
{y|{mHave a seat! Enjoy yourself! But first, you should know how things work {y|
{y|{maround here. We serve only fresh drinks here. Joram will serve em right {y|
{y|{mup for ya upon request, just ask for it by name. Enjoy your stay at our {y|
{y|{mfine Tavern.  Serving Waterdhavens for over a century!                  {y|
{y|                                 {G- {GT{gerras{x, {gSpouting Fish Tavern Owner   {y|
{y|                 {W*{rTHE SPOUTING FISH BAR DRINK LIST{W*                     {y|
{3You have entered a rather large, and spacey Tavern.  The place is
rather old looking, and well worn from daily use.  The floorboards creak,
The tavern bar is marked and signaturized by adventurers of the past.  The
tables are crowded and packed - as usual for this tavern.  The crowd is
rather loud though, and quite rambunctious as people toss around their mugs
of ale, and rough each other around with playful, but hard, punches to each
