other.  Everyone, including the staff of the tavern, seems quite busy.
Perhaps that is why the {!menu{3 is posted on the wall, and not handed to each
customer.  {0
{3                       |{6THE SP{^OUTI{6NG FISH{3|
20631.name: {cThe Sp{Couti{cing Fish {r=[{w<{W*{w((((<{r]={x

description: This clean, paved road is lined with majestic architecture of highly
erected, three story buildings.  Many of the buildings here hold banners and
crests of some sort, which shows that this area is of high nobility and
important social classes.  Waterdeep way continues east and west.
20863.name: {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep {yWay{x

description: The Dock Street continues along the boardwalk, which opens here at
the base of the mountainous rising, and the vast expanse of the Sea of
Swords, where countless seafaring vessels crowd in upon one another.
Here, the terrain is slightly higher than the harbor iself, offering
up a spectacular view of the rows of docks and clusters of ships.  Far
across the harbor runs a stretch of wall, built many centuries ago to
protect the last vestige of vunerability for the city.  The street
continues east and west.
20727.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: This single room is the pride of the Unicorn's Horn.  A massive bed
that could fit seven sits at the center of the room, lavishly
decorated with ribbons of silk tied between its four large posts.  A
gas chandelier hangs just in front, and many pieces of furniture are
scattered about the room.  To the west is a wide window opening out to
a balcony, where a breathtaking view of the city can be seen.
20992.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: This street is accented by elaborately adorned buildings and
brightly colored banners.  Several high profile shops have been set up
along its length, intermingled with temples, shrines, and extravagant
villas.  Some old world buildings still remain in the form of
converted cathedrals and wizard studies, perhaps the most prominent of
the latter lying due west of here up a sloping ridge.  Known by many
as the Blackstaff, this tower looms as a black line drawn perfectly
vertical from a tall curtain wall, resembling a butter churner that
has been charred from tip to base.  The Street of Silks continues
south, merging with Julthoon to the north, while to the west begins a
private path up to the black wizard's tower.
20907.name: The {mStr{Wee{mt of S{Wi{mlks{x

description: Delzorin Street continues east and west, through the wealthy
neighborhoods of nobility.  The villas which lie on either side of the
street are grand displays of wealth, and could house a dozen or more
people comfortably within, yet more commonly 3 or less inhabit them,
as a testament to what money can buy even in a city straining for
every pinch of space it can muster.  A grand mansion lies to the
north, while to the south is a shop with many extravagant pieces of
armor and weaponry on display in the window.
20966.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: The west wall towers high to the west of this road which straddles
it.  There is the occasional opening in the wall, with steep stairs
leading up to the top, but otherwise the view to the western sea
remains obstructed.  Long lamp arms jut out from the wall, where the
night lamps hang.  Their frequent placement and the large number of
Waterdeep's watch which patrols here makes this area very safe in any
hour of the day.
20848.name: {MW{mest{Rw{rall {GS{gtr{cee{gt{x

description: This small, wooden store has been built so that all it's walls were
turned into shelvings for the numerous charts, maps, and documents on
the sites of the realms.  Four long tables fill up the body of this
room and upon them are all types of cluttered objects.  One table has
two globes in different sizes, another has a large map unscrolled with
a compass and pencil atop it, while another tables is cluttered with
books that give information on the extensive library of charts and
maps within the collection of the library turned store.
20763.name: {GS{ce{mr{cpen{mt{ci{Gl {BB{books {8and {YF{yolios{x

description: This road is narrow, made narrower by the many shops and guilds
that spill out into the streets, as well as the many people who come
here to take advantage of the bargains to be found throughout.  Along
the northeast runs the wall of the City of the Dead, which doesn't
deter peddlers from setting up nearby.  In irony, there are even some
peddlers selling longevity potions and even undead repellents within
the shadows of the graveyard city.
20824.name: {8Wall Way{x

description: {x
The High Road continues north and south through the City of Splendors,
interrupted only slightly by the intersecting street that occur every
so often, yet despite the number of inersections the High Road stands
the most prominent of them all.  Being the widest street in Waterdeep
and accented by frequent signs there is little reason to stray off it
unless one wishes to take a detour down one of the side streets where
commerce and wonders are abound, or for those without a sense of self-
preservation, danger is lurking in wait down nearly every dark alley.{x
20788.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: This is a small, one room apartment, most likely for a commoner in the
city.  There is a simple bed, table, and fireplace in the room, each
corroded with dirt and grime due to their lack of clean upkeep.
20708.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: {1This small tower rises as a slim stone pinnacle with few windows, and a
conical roof four stories from the street.  It is extremely quiet here,
almost as if the tower wards away any disturbances and shuns off any type of
noise.  The only descript feature of the tower is a faint barrie-like glow
shimmering in the air around the tower.  {0 {rand a very ugly looking
gargoyle head set as a ward at the tower's gates.  {x
20952.name: {!Ahghairon's Tower{0

description: The wide street opens to an intersection where many people
congregate.  To the north and south, Diamond Street runs in a
distinctive paving of white stone.  Further to the north, Diamond
Street opens into a park, seemingly very popular as many people gather
and walk about it.  Many high, stylish structures have been erected in
this ward of the city, mostly religious in nature, but some placed as
inspirational art pieces, most during the time of Waterdeep's cultural
renaissance.  This avenue is distinctive in the many statuettes and
symbolic sculptures which line the sidewalks, as every religion fights
for their own recognition.
20942.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: Slut Streets ends rather abruptly here at a wide roundabout where
another larger street begins to the west.  The other street seemingly
engulfs this modest avenue, which has seemingly no other use here than
to grant access to a rather shady looking nightclub just south of
here.  A few other shops and living quarters line the streets, but
most look to be in grave disarray, seemingly abandoned be it not for
signs that they are still in use.
20751.name: {RS{yl{cu{yt {wSt{8r{cee{wt{x

description: This small, quaint shop has many racks of tanned, and stretched leather
lying about - some currently being washed, some being dried by the
fireplace, and others being stretched to be used for wearable gear.  The
shop reeks of the smell of fresh leather, as one would suspect, and the
floor and windows have a yellowish haze from the dust the leather releases
when it is worked on.
20778.name: {3The F{#i{3ne Leatherworker{0

description: Sul Street continues through the heart of the Sea Ward, passing by
many well regarded places, mostly temples and villas, though the
occasional guildhall or political building passes by, reminding
Waterdhavens of the cogs upon which the city runs.  Sul is a modestly
laid out street, paved of simple mortarless red brick, patterned in
repeats of elbow turns.  The splendor of its surroundings upgrades its
otherwise ordinary appearance, making it blend in seamlessly with the
rest of the ward.  To the north, Delzorin begins, while to the south,
Sul intersects with its sister street Sulmor.
20983.name: {YSul {yStreet{x

description: You stand before a massive cast iron gate with guards patrolling
the entrance.  To the west you see a street which winds off into the
depths of the thickly settled city, and to the east the High Road
links up with the Trade Way.
20601.name: Within the {CG{cate{Cs {8of {BWa{bt{8e{wr{8d{be{Bep {8- {wT{8he {RS{routh {RG{rate{x

description: Stay in one place long enough, and one can see the whole spectrum
of weapons being carried by people of all trades of battle.  This is
Warrior's Way, where recognized and self proclaimed warriors loiter
about and otherwise make their way north to the bazaar to set
theirselves out as mercenaries for hire.  The buildings here are a mix
of wood and stone, both traditional and modern architectures, and
housing some of the most well known and notorious guilds of warfare in
all of Waterdeep.  To the east is set up an apothecary shop, while
Warrior's Way continues north and south.
20893.name: {rW{Ra{wr{Wri{wo{Rr{r's {RW{Wa{wy{x

description: This long road is made out of pure black stone cut into 3 by 3
squares and fit snuggly together almost looking as one long slab of
stone trailing across from east to west.  The building structures here
are large, two story buildings - some made of stone, others made out
of expensive wood.  The sidewalks of this street is beautifully
decorated with plants everywhere, and some even hang from the outside
of people's windows.  The area here is peacefully quiet and away from
all the traffic commonly seen in most of Waterdeep.  Just to the west
stands a massive garden, its beauty beyond words.
20960.name: {WSk{8u{Wlls {wS{8treet{x at the {BH{Ye{Wro{Ye{Bs' {GG{ga{yrd{ge{yn{x

description: The streets are quiet and very few people are out and about.  The
occasional officer of Waterdeep's watch patrol wanders by their usual
round.  To the east the street intersects with another.  North and
south are elegant villas of the noble class of Waterdeep.
20965.name: {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: Waterdeep Way continues east and south.  Along the northern walk
are lined row after row of uniquely elegant architectural styles,
characteristic of the many eras of Waterdeep's history.  The buildings
here in this district of the Castle Ward are mostly administrative,
placed close to the governing center of the city--the Castle Waterdeep
and palace grounds.  Only a few of the buildings represent a privately
owned structure, as the governing arm has extended many centuries of
landgrabbing.  Those who still own a piece here are no doubt
influential families, the likes of Lords and nobles, or those the
governme
20859.name: {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep {yWay{x

description: The Way of the Dragon opens to a small intersection, branching off
toward Castle Waterdeep by means of Soothsayer Way to the west.  Paved
in near perfectly square cut blocks accented with iron struts along
either side, The square is a mark of excellence and craft for the
city, representing a gateway to the monarchy, and an avenue for
adventure as it traverses and intersects with major streets throughout
the city.  Along the streets stand large multi storied buildings of
stone and wood construction, many elegantly crafted with tall reaching
spires and intricate eaves and windows.  People fill the streets and
hang from balconies enjoying yet another day in Waterdeep.
20758.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: {8A crooked alley begins here, running south through dark, twisting
corridors.  Aptly named Snake Alley, this cut through resembles a
serpent from the twisting walkthrough, to the scale-like texture of
the slimy bricks which cover the side walls.  To the north is Grocer's
Lane, while the alleyway leads southward, serving as a cutthrough for
folks looking to save some time on their journey.  {x
20667.name: {gS{cnak{ge {rA{8lle{ry{x

description: The elder runes of Lammath - safety and shelter, Retniw - camping place,
a Harper's mark of Safe haven, and the elvish and dwarvish runes for Safe
Refuge adorn the signs giving off a {7faint aura{0.
The street widens as a courtyard with many shops and businesses
opening out into the street.  Of note especially is a spectactular
three-story stone building to the north, being one of the tallest in
the ward.  Its sides are flanked by large wooden plank signs which
swing in the breeze at the inn's second story.  Many runes are carved
into the support beams, emitting a warm aura.  Above the heavy
ash-wood double doors, golden letters are set in the stone archway,
proclaiming this building as the {YSafehaven {yInn{x.  Kerrigan's Court
continues west and south from here.
20671.name: {MK{me{rr{8ri{rg{ma{Mn's {BCourt{x

description: Just outside the colliseum of waterdeep is a grand stairway spanning at
least 80 feet long and lead up to an archway fashioned out of stone.  The
stone archway has been chiseled into and articulately designed into the head
of a great lion.  It's massive teeth descend down below the arch at the
entrance and have crumbled a bit most likely due to people - mostly kids -
entering the stadium and jumping up to touch the structure.  Just beyond the
mouth of the lion is a grand hallway leading to the inner fighting grounds
of the colliseum.
20921.name: The {GField {xof {cT{mr{Rium{mp{ch{x

description: A few degenerate individuals hang about here, but otherwise the
noble and dignified character of this district remains unspoiled.  The
wide avenue continues north and south, intersecting with another
street that runs eastward from here.  The street to the east is less
established, seemingly overrun with vagrants.  In contrast the Way of
the Dragon is inviting, with several street lamps and benches lining
the walkways, and placed here and there are drinking fountains to be
used freely by the public.
20653.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: The dark stone road known as Skulls Street continues east and west
here, following the North Trollwall loosely as it makes its way to the
sea.  Carved in large 3 by 3 blocks of black stone, this road gives
the area a strange quality, almost foreboding, but any hesitation is
quickly abated by the sight of children playing along the road, and
citizens of the city strolling it in a leisurely manner Many colorful
plants line the sidewalks, and the faint sound of music can be heard
from one of the many open windows which look out to the street.
20958.name: {WSk{8u{Wlls {wS{8treet{x

description: Sleepers Walk narrows to the southern gates of the City of the
Dead, directly north of here.  The narrowing of all roads leading into
the graveyard is a tradition that takes root in the idea of lessening
the flow of dead Waterdhavians to the grave.  Still, death is a thing
to be celebrated in as much as it is mourned, and the gates and walls
of the graveyard are rich in ornate detail, almost beautiful in
design.  Here and elsewhere within the graveyard shadows one can find
artistic inspiration, colorful characters, and adventure abound.  To
the north is the City of the Dead, while Wall Way begins west of here,
meandering about the former.
20815.name: {cSl{yee{cp{ye{cr's {wW{ca{8l{wk{x

description: The wide avenue known as the Way of the Dragon begins here on the
northern end.  Extending through most of the southern half of the
city, this avenue is renoun for offering a somewhat more leisurely
tour of the city, as opposed to the fast paced High Road running east
parallel to this road.  A few shops are setup along the length, but
otherwise the walk is accented by an interesting mix of extravagant
architectures and several offerings for lodging.  To the east is a
modest looking shop, displaying all manner of colorful cloths.
20799.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: This wide, paved road is lined with majestic architecture of highly
erected, three story buildings.  Many of the buildings here hold
banners and crests of some sort, which shows that this area is of high
nobility and important social classes.  To the north is the mansion of
great beauty.  To the south is an equally impressive building, very
tall and distinctively stylish of a city governing establishment.
Waterdeep Way continues east and west.
20860.name: {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep {yWay{x

description: Two large iron gates stand closed here with guards of the watch posted
to uphold Waterdeep's ordinance that no one be allowed within the City
of the Dead after hours. The gates are blackened iron, reddened with a
layer of rust in patches and secured upon two massive stone pillars on
which are carved the likeness of skulls and bones. The wall around the
City of the Dead is tall and crowned with iron spikes, deterring those
who would seek to break the curfew.  Suldown Street runs north of here.{x
20844.name: The {RNorth {WGates {xto the {8C{ri{8ty of the D{re{8ad{x

description: This wide avenue leads from the Way of the Dragon to the east, all
the way to the gates of Castle Waterdeep, which can be seen near to
the west, towering above the courtyard where the watch of Waterdeep
gather and march out each day.  The buildings here are quite majestic,
representing the best of the city.  Fine quality brick paves the roads
here, though relatively new is well worn from frequent use.  To the
south is a quaint looking shop with many books and maps on display.
20759.name: {mS{Moo{mths{Ma{myer's {BW{bay{x

description: River street continues east and west, leading out to the River Gate
to the east and merging with the High Road to the west.  Several
medium sized buildings line the street here, a few of them are shops,
but the majority being used for storage.  Several people walk along
the street, but the numbers here are nothing compared to the stretch
of High Road just west of here.
20783.name: {cR{Ci{Wv{Ce{cr {BStreet{x

description: Sulmor Street continues east and west here, cutting through a
wealthy cluster of villas where the nobles live.  These villas are
striking in their design: very little wood, as most are stone and iron
constructs representing gaudy and bold styles which are masterworks of
local guildsmen.  Despite the shortage of space in the city, many of
these homes display lush gardens, patios and balconies from which
their residence can watch the going ons of the city, without taking
part in it themselves.  Known as one of the quietest and most
leisurely walks, some go as far as saying the neighborhoods here are
boring, though what goes on behind closed doors is anything but.
20931.name: {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: Racks of all sizes take up most of the space in this large shop
which carry a vast amount of many different types of lances and
hunting equipment.  In the far north is the sales counter where a few
miscellaneous weapons can be bought as well, but overall, this shop
deals in lances.
20840.name: {mR{yi{caut{ya{mr's {rW{Re{ra{8po{rn{Rr{ry{x

description: The run takes a turn here, veering to the west and to the south as
it cuts along a narrow lot of tall buildings to the north.  A few
alleyways connect this street with the parallel running east and west,
just north of here.  The turn opens the normally narrow Weeping
Maiden's Run into a wider circle, where a few fortune tellers and
vendors have setup for business.  At the corner here is a perfect view
of the bustling businesses located in the maiden's court just south of
here.
20659.name: {cW{Cee{cping {WM{wa{yide{wn{W's {GR{gun{x

description: Banners stretch across this small square, as a stretch of road
called the Weeping Maiden's Run juts east of the main avenue that runs
north and south called the Way of the Dragon.  Several multi storied
buildings tower above the streets here, with balconies that wrap
around corners, and in places, roped walkways connecting one window to
another.  To the west, a seemingly popular tavern is open for
business, as meandering drunks and brash individuals go to and fro its
two large swinging doors.  Piles of trash line the gutters, which is
swept daily by the janitorial guilds.
20654.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: Wall Way curves about here as the graveyard wall wraps around the
dead city to the east.  Here along the wall is the bustle of trade, as
many people gather and barter, or use this street as a pass through to
get from one locale to the other, to otherwise avoid the fast paced
traffic of the main arteries of Waterdeep.  It is within these small
patches off the beaten path that the best deals can be found, evident
by the number of Waterdhavens roaming about here.
20821.name: {8Wall Way{x

description: This modest street follows the west wall, which is surprisingly
clean and devoid of grafitti and defacement here.  The Sea Ward is
kept clean and ordered, governed by strict curfews and regulations on
what people can do here.  Who can sell and who can live within these
lavish homes.  This would best be described as the ass end of the many
elegant buildings abound in the ward, characteristic by the secondhand
stones and chipping paint used in building them, though very few
people care, because no one really walks this way anyway.  The west
gates are not too far to the north of here.
20849.name: {MW{mest{Rw{rall {GS{gtr{cee{gt{x

description: This wide, paved road is lined with majestic architecture of highly
erected, three story buildings.  Many of the buildings here hold banners and
crests of some sort, which shows that this area is of high nobility and
important social classes.  A large building made entirely of mosaic lies
directly to the north, while the circle of waterdeep is just east of here.
20804.name: {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep {yWay{x

description: {x
Numerous signs extend from the buildings attempting to catch the eye of
a passerby and lure them into the shops that overpopulate the area.  To
the east is a large inn painted in light cream white with the oversized
head of a unicorn adorning its doors. A portly individual stands by the
doors, waving and calling to people to stop and rest a spell before the
journey ahead.  Many take him up on the offer, as the doors remain open.
20803.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: This dirt packed road hardly seems fitting in this thriving
metropolis, yet it seems more appropriate down an isolated stretch of
farmland, be it not for the tall buildings and somewhat more developed
sidewalk areas that surround it.  Old and fresh hay lie mixed and
trodden along the road, to minimize the spread and odor of animal
manure.  This road is perpetually ran by horses and other draft
animals, pulling their loads to and from the great Caravan Court to
the east.  To the west is the High Road, which engulfs this small
stretch in another world of fast paced city life.
20620.name: {yCaravan {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: This large, wide street runs east to west connecting the high road
to the western side of waterdeep.  Many high, stylish looking
structures line this road, along with many temples that look like
masterpieces of art.  The street is made of onyx black cobblestone
which is neatly fitted together, making it easy to travel upon.  A
beautiful temple looking to be made completely of flowers, and hues of
deep reds and purples lies to the north with symbols depicting that of
a fair maiden.  Delzorin continues east and west through the Sea Ward.
20948.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: {x
The High Road continues through Waterdeep City--the extra wide street
seems large enough for a ship to traverse, should Waterdeep ever fall
victim to flooding. The prospect of this is slim, given that the city
has one of the most advanced sewage systems in all the realms.  Along
the road are set generous numbers of lamps kept well-lit by the light
man, whose only job it is to walk up and down the street lighting the
lamps, and then back around to put each one out when the sun rises in
the east. The faint sounds of mooring bells can be heard far westward.
20813.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: The street curves about here as it meanders between the unevenly
partitioned city blocks.  Centuries of social progress has hardly put
a dent into the stubborn layout of the Dock Ward, as warehouses share
streetfronts with vegetable stands, and stables double as makeshift
quarters for seafarers skimping on a decent room at the nearest inn.
Scarcely were roads even considered as greedy enterpeneurs pushed
their businesses further and further into the streets, in places
completely blocking lanes that otherwise spilled into the opposite
walkways.  These tinderbox buildings are frequently threatened by
fires, and only then when licked clean by flame do they yield to
social stability, molding these streets slowly into maneuverable
grids.  Snail Street makes an S curve here, west and south, and to the
east curves another street, creatively named Slut.
20746.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: The lights along the street keep it well lit, even at moonless
nights.  This street holds many random shops and guilds along it's
path and connects to both entrances of the city of the dead graveyard
just over the wall northeast of here.  The smell of leather fills the
air from a store to the south filled with assorted boots.  Also, to
the west is a great wooden structure known as the citadel of the arrow
- the ranger's guild.  Rivon street continues its path from the north
to the east.
20825.name: {8Wall Way{x

description: A narrow gate is set just off the Street of Silk, leading up a
steep set of stairs to an path of onyx, and beyond it a jet black
tower of modest size.  The gate is decorated with blooming flowers and
remains unlatched, seemingly a welcoming gesture for those wishing to
journey to the tower.  Little is known about the tower at the end of
this pathway, but for certain there are many who pass by without so
much as a glance.  The uneasyness in their eyes is unmistakable.
20602.name: {CG{ca{gt{ce{Cs {8to {cBl{8ac{wks{Wtaf{wf T{8ow{cer{x

description: The clean and modern feel of this avenue lends little hint as to
its rich history, most notably as a staging ground for the armies of
Waterdeep in their fight against invaders, but also the soothsayers
who gathered here in masses to proclaim the prophecies, some proven
truer than others, to the king and his city.  This wide street is also
a popular staging grounds for large groups who come seeing audience
with the king and queen, as well as a commons area for the citizens of
the city when summoned by the monarchy.  As such, it is a center of
culture and history that reflects in the architecture and in the faces
of those who call this area home.
20761.name: {mS{Moo{mths{Ma{myer's {BW{bay{x

description: Small puddles gather in and around the road, as the sea brings in
frequent rain to the dismay, and sometimes joy of Waterdhavens.  The
sloping street suggests its age, where low and high spots build due to
probably centuries of use and abuse.  Temples, regarded for their
beauty, use highly ornate waterspouts to push the rain onto the
street, preserving its own heritage while trodding on its main artery.
Many elaborate religious symbols can be seen lining the walls of
almost every villa and building that one passes through this ward.
20946.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: Sulmor street cuts through many elegantly adorned villas accented
(and kept safe) by wrought iron gates and fencing.  Faint partying can
be heard from behind closed doors and walls, but otherwise the streets
are quiet here in the city.  Sulmor street continues east and west,
and to the west it intersects with a wide road that cuts through the
city.
20940.name: {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: A sweet smell of freshly baked pastries fills this small bakery.  A large
pane window has been oddly placed in the ceiling where the light of the sun,
or even the moons when they are full, can cast their light through to light
up this shop.  At the large wooden counter that spans across the whole store
from north to south are dozens of baking goods from croissants to large
baguettes and loaves of bread.
20975.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: This small shop is shelved with all sorts of goods for the well
preparing traveller.  Included in this store are all the things one
would need to go on a hiking trip, or road trip, for quite a few days.
20775.name: The {yHiker's {gRequest{x

description: This storeroom lies well concealed behind the main storehouse
inventory.  It is uncertain whether or not this was hidden on purpose,
or simply forgotten over time.  In the darkness, several empty crates
and barrels can be seen.  A few bear marks that predate any of today's
known shipping houses.  A foul smell lingers in the air, and it is
uncertain where its origin lies.
20772.name: A {8Back {rStoreroom{x

description: A large crack through the Trollwall forms a narrow tunnel here.
The sounds of chanting can be faintly heard deep within, while the
quiet streets of the north ward lie outside, where the light can still
be seen.
20988.name: A {rcr{Rac{rked {Bsection{x of the {gTr{Go{gll{yw{ca{yll{x

description: {4An eerie silence overtakes this small inn.  There are only three tables
in the whole place, which suggests that the inn isn't a very popular one.
{4Nonetheless, the fact that everything is painted {8black{4 - the chairs,
tables, walls, floor, and windows - suggests that {4there is possibly
something secretly brewing here beyond what the naked eye would see...  {0
20765.name: {4The {8Blackstar {4Inn{0

description: {8A few people can be encountered here, but otherwise few people
prefer to take this otherwise convenient cut through, opting instead a
more traveled route.  Resembling a serpent in its meandering, this
alley is aptly named Snake Alley by locals.  The adjoining buildings
do not have doors opening to this alley, though piles of trash seem to
gather here regardless.  Snake alley continues east and north through
dark twists and turns.  {x
20668.name: {gS{cnak{ge {rA{8lle{ry{x

description: Whaelgond Way continues north and south.  The sewer covers here are
rounded and shaped like wagon wheels--a favorite symbol of the god of
craft.  This ancient alleyway turned street was once the established
locale for some of Waterdeeps early coachmakers, though the trollwars
turned it into a vast warehouse district where seige engines were
constructed.  In modern days, the builders moved further south to be
closer to the docks where their building materials now come in.
Coachmakers to the south, and enginecraft to the southwest, the locale
has changed, but the craft remains the same.  To the west a quaint
pastry shop is opened up.
20973.name: {yWh{Yae{yl{8gond {YW{yay{x

description: The two celestialesque avenues, Sul and Sulmor converge at this
modest intersection.  Sulmor is the predominant entity here, as the
red brick paving of Sul stops abruptly to make way for the more bold
stone lined surface of Sulmor.  Buildings here are grand structures,
though clearly not the outward facing side, as secondary architectural
elements-small arches and window accents are visible out to the
street.  Modest stairways lead up into buildings, having long learned
that flooding can make low lying floors less than hospitable.
20889.name: {YSul {xat {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: This small shop smells distinctly of fish.  The walls and floors here
creak and moan almost on their own will - most likely due to age and
warping.  At the counter, which is centered at the center of the room, many
racks of freshly gutted and sliced fish are on display, waiting to be
bought.  The store isn't very clean, but it's what one would expect from an
average fish market.
20977.name: Fallen Stars Fish

description: A wide walkway dips in front of a very lavish looking villa set
within one of the most prominent districts in all of Waterdeep City.
The palace grounds are a stone's throw away from this three story
home, tall and slender as the confinements of expanding space will
allow.  Two elegant marble statues greet visitors at the gate
entrance, where a steep stairway leads up to a terraced front landing
where a garden grove grows.  The villa is a classic flat, boxlike
style, with bright, multicolored awnings covering numerous small
windows and thick, stylized molding trimming every eave and overhang.
Several small gargoyles sit atop the roof, which juts out to a modest
incline, despite the heavy rainfall that comes with the seasons here.
Though the decor is very inviting, the small but significant fact that
the villa gates remain closed and locked suggest this private
residence is not open to the public.
20623.name: In {BFront {xof a {WL{warge {MV{milla{x

description: The street here makes a natural transition via the stonework from
reddish brown to black, as it joins with the lone walk to the northern
gates of the City of the Dead.  Two skulled pillars mark the entrance
to the city, with a sign hanging up detailing t which forbids anyone
from entering the graveyard after hours.  This spot along the street
is somewhat chilling, and many travelers who must go this way do so
quickly and without diverting their eyes from the road.
20673.name: {rS{wuldow{rn {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: {8The alley is extremely narrow here making it only big enough for
one person to squeeze through at a time.  The buildings surrounding
here look extremely high, mostly due to the angle at which you have no
choice but to look at them.  The alley is dark, and shadowy, making it
hard to see what lurks here.  A few piles of trash fill the alley
making it hard to walk.  Light breaks from the east, suggesting the
alley ends there.  {x
20738.name: {gG{8ut All{gey{x

description: An old copper sign depicting the deity Waukeen hangs from a rotting
support timber just above the entryway to this small, cluttered shop.
The walls and floor are splintering from years of neglect and from the
weight of countless items hanging from beams and piled upon shattered
floor tiles.  This looks to be a pawn shop, though hopelessly
cluttered even for the worst of pawns.  Dozens of trinkets,
curiosities and junk are everywhere, some hanging, some buried beneath
other things, and some seemingly set out on makeshift shelving as
displays.  Unfortunately, due to the poor lighting of the room by a
single torch, it is hard for one to see everything there is to offer.
20686.name: {yWa{Yuke{yen's {rWares{x

description: This short and narrow lane is unusually clean for such a heavily
used street.  The characteristic red brick buildings here still retain
the deep red hue of fresh brick, and the sidewalk areas are free of
excess dirt kicked up from the road.  To the south is an old two story
building that seems to be falling in on itself.  An old copper sign
denotes it as Waukeen's Wares, and the piles of junk displayed out
onto the street suggests it is a pawn shop.
20664.name: {gGrocer's Lane{x

description: Immar Street bends here as it meets up with the North Trollwall,
rising high and spanning deep and promoting an air of security.  There
has nary been a century gone by since a major attack on the city took
place, a fact that can be seen in the age of the homes here--old
masonry accented with traditional styles.  Style itself is ageless
here, as the homes are mostly of the old times, which modern archtects
revere and emulate to this day.  It is not uncommon to find villas in
the sea ward which look strangely similiar to the more authentically
old homes found here, though for both price and history, there is no
comparison.
20891.name: {8Immar {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: Beneath runs thick timbers evenly spaced, from which the dock
street is built.  Below, the salty sea licks the timbers which holds
everything up, as smaller vessels moor for lack of funds to use the
municipal facilities.  Waterdeep rises up to the east, literally, as
the streets run up an incline.  To the north, the great Mount
Waterdeep rises up through the clouds while a vast stretch of masts
jut out across the dark Sea of Swords to the west.  Dock Street
continue east and north from here.
20725.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: Just off the High Road, Delzorin Street ventures through the north
ward district, passing the grand villas of the nobility of Waterdeep.
While such extravagant homes are also seen elsewhere, namely in the
sea and castle wards, none take on more of a traditional and massive
scale as those found here.  These are the homes of the established
nobility: the "old money" as some refer to them.  Many see living here
as a respectable place to retire and live life at a slower pace.
Crime in this ward is very low, but so is the prospect of adventure.
The city watch patrols these streets relentlessly, as the watchmen are
paid very well for very little work.  Delzorin continues east through
the north ward, and west it intersects with the main artery of the
city: the High Road.
20856.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: {yHere in the back of the stables line stalls from which all sorts of
horses and other mounts are kept.  The smell of dry hay and old manuer
is quite overwhelming and flies seem to pester around everywhere.  {x
20870.name: {YStables{x

description: This avenue is constructed of large 3 feet squares fitted closely
together to create a very stable, and smooth walking ground.  Its unique
road construction is due to its usage of heavy wagons and carts that are
continuously traveling from the high road to the bazaar, or even further
west, the great arena colliseum.  The building structures here are all made
of stone, and a few broken wagons lay spread out along their sides most
likely from overusage at the bazaar.
20918.name: {!Julthoon Street{0

description: {8A strange mist lingers about in the darkness, with shadows so deep
that they could almost engulf unsuspecting victims in a thick tar of
anonymity.  The alley twists and turns, narrows and widens, though
only slightly as it makes it way between the buildings.  Silence
lingers, breaking only momentarily as a stray animal digs through a
trash barrel or the wind stirs a piece of paper.  Gut Alley continues
south and east from here.  {x
20737.name: {gG{8ut All{gey{x

description: Weeping Maiden's Run continues north and south here, paved in the
coarse, jagged stones that often give this street name some creedence
to barefooted travelers.  Several buildings line the sides of the run,
but few open out to this side.  The street is poorly lit in places,
often the best illuminated spots are in front of the late operating
shops, which generate good revenues in the after hours.
20660.name: {cW{Cee{cping {WM{wa{yide{wn{W's {GR{gun{x

description: This Court is perhaps the least developed yard in all of Waterdeep.
The ground is simple packed dirt scattered in hay to soak up animal
droppings.  A few crooked posts stand staked in the ground seemingly
at random and used to tie up animals.  Deep ruts create complex
crossover patterns in the ground as business is all the talk amidst a
flurry of laughing and swearing.  And the smell here is unbearable by
most anyone who does not spend their days around draft animals.  The
eastern Trollwall runs along the eastern side of the court, while
buildings surround it on the other sides.  Two roads lead in and out
of here, one placed southwest, and the other northwest.
20625.name: {yCaravan {YC{yourt{x

description: The street widens as the great gates of the Field of Triumph opens
to the north, the colliseum rising high there, covering several city
blocks and drawing in a huge crowd.  The citywatch is heavy here as
well, as illicit trade and barter runs rampant, along with
pickpocketing and swindling, though such transgressions are often seen
being met with drawn blades.  Just to the south, several
establishments capitalize on the crowds, though their plots are narrow
and rocky, as the cutaway cliffs of Mount Waterdeep rises sharply
behind them.  Space is scare and valuable here, and the barren rocky
cliffs to the south bear testament to the difficulty in utilizing the
terrain.  Julthoon continues east, while ending a short distance west
at the Trollwall and Westwall Street.
20845.name: {RJulthoon Street{x

description: This street is finely paved in durable flat stones, most likely
pulled from the Dessarin.  They are cut and laid with care, having no
more than a finger's thickness between them.  Most are small stones,
no bigger than the size of an average human's head, and thus they
follow the contours of the road closely.  Heavy traffic has over the
years, upturned a few, which are periodically reset by the guild of
masons.  The Way of the Dragon cuts through the heart of south central
Waterdeep, forming the dividing line between the Southern and Dock
wards.  Here, a strange dichotomy of poverty stricken housing lies to
the east side of the street, while to the west are abandoned and
dilapidated storehouses, too poor a condition even for storage.
20647.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: Buildings increase in size and stature, as one moves south to north
along the Way of the Dragon.  Decisive class differences can be seen
among the different areas of the city, as high density living has
drawn dividing lines among rich and poor.  The impoverished
Waterdhaven will live in one of two types of places: an old converted
warehouse where several families live in a communal society, or much
more commonly, in a tiny, one room apartment sorely in need of repair.
Sanitation is the poorest here, as waste buckets are discarded upon
the streets when thralls and the city watch is not looking.  For them,
it is an increased burden in their lives to simply toss it down the
sewage hole.  The street continues north and south.
20648.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: This wide, paved road is most definitely the pinnacle of richness
in homes of Waterdeep save Piergeiron's Palace.  Some of the most
grandest homes of Waterdeep reside here, and it shows in the wonderous
structures that surround the street.  Spires, and gables of noble
villas are sporadically placed along with temples devoted to the some
of the more popular gods and goddesses of Faerun.  The structures have
an air of stateliness and majesty, and the variety of building details
are astounding.  The grand entrance to the fabled House of the Moon
temple lies to the west while Dolphin Street continues north and
south.
20924.name: {yS{wtr{8ee{yt {xof the {MS{gi{Gngi{gn{Mg {CDolphin{x

description: The small street which follows the westwall ends abruptly here to
the north, combining with Diamond Street and leading out into the west
gates of Waterdeep, which is just west of here.  The wall continues
north from here, rising in height as it traverses the perimeter of the
craggy cliffs overlooking the Sea of Swords.  The sounds of the surf
beating upon the rocks below can be faintly heard here, as the dull
rumble of city life can be heard to the east.
20866.name: {MW{mest{Rw{rall {GS{gtr{cee{gt{x

description: The hallroom of this building is a breathtaking sight.  It holds some of
the finest stonemasons and their work shows in their superb artwork when
they made this guild.  The walls, floor, and ceiling are made of pure stone,
cut and smoothed to perfection and held up by very intricately detailed
pillars depicting an array of fruits.  In each pillar lies a mount where a
torch is always blazing and giving off light to illuminate the room.  The
light creeps into the back of the room where there is a large stone slab
table, and further back is a spiraling stairway leading up.
20692.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: {cThis spot marks the center of the market bazaar, where a maze of
carts and stalls sit, confusing left and right, north and south.  All
around is the sounds of haggling, arguing, and luring, which for a
seasoned shopper is just another day at market.  Some makeshift
lighting has been placed here, to extend the hours of operation well
into the sunset hours.  Here too, the city watch cannot be easily
seen, as they prefer to stand watch outside of the heart of the
Bazaar, making the prospect of crime the greatest here than anywhere
else.  {x
20915.name: {3Bazaar Market Square{0

description: Singing Dolphin ends here, as it meets up with the trollwall to the
north.  To the east begins Skulls Street, named for the time when
troll invasions brought much bloodshed to this area.  Remnants of
those great battles still remain, as the great Trolltower rises to the
north, and further out past the city walls is a heavily fortified
unofficial gate into the city, known as the Trollfort.  A lowly tavern
lies just off the street, but otherwise the buildings here are rather
plain and function, at least for this high profile district of the
City.
20939.name: {MS{gi{Gngi{gn{Mg {CDolphin{x at {WSk{8u{Wlls {wS{8treet{x

description: Sulmor Street runs east and west, ending at the great High Road
just east while stretching across the Sea Ward, where much of
Waterdeep's temple complexes are built.  The architecture here is some
of the city's oldest and finest.  The streets here run true to one
another, blocking off the ward neatly in the middle, while giving way
to less order further north and west.  Several shops line the streets,
but otherwise things are quiet.
20883.name: {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: Several older structures besides temples and villas exist in this
part of Waterdeep City, namely old wizard's towers from back when such
things were fashionable.  Though age and the elements have beaten down
on them, they still remain miraculously, or perhaps magically, inta
The defining feature of this stretch of street are the decorate
banners and tapestries which hang on the tall buildings on either
side.  A bow to the age when the silk trade brought much needed
revenue to this once depressed area of Waterdeep, many of these
decorative elements are made from pure silk.
20880.name: The {mStr{Wee{mt of S{Wi{mlks{x

description: Julthoon is one of Waterdeep's most traveled streets, cutting
through the northern half of the Castle Ward and passing some of the
higher profile buildings of the city.  Just south of here rises a
ridge along the slopes of Mount Waterdeep, where a dark wizard's tower
looms in strange, almost mystical haze.  To the north, the merry
street of Dolphins begins, passing by many temples and shrines, and
just to the northwest the sounds of the great Field of Triumph can be
heard echoing through alleyways.  Not far to the west is the trollwall
near the Cliffwatch, where the cliffs of Deepwater Harbor begins,
dropping down many paces as it cuts south through Waterdeep's bustling
seafaring industry.
20920.name: {MS{gi{Gngi{gn{Mg {CDolphin{x at {RJulthoon Street{x

description: The silver pestal and morder and bag of herbs lying about on a large
counter in the back immediately gives away that this is an apothecary.  To
the east is a small comfortable looking chair at which a victim of illnesse
can sit and relax in while administrated to.  To the south is a small table
with a few herbal remedies, and back west leads the way out.
20900.name: {cApothecary{x

description: Saerdown street continues along the eastern edge of Waterdeep City,
as the Trollwall begins here to the north, circumventing near the
whole of the City of Spendors.  Here to the south is the cliffwatch--a
break in the city walls marked by a 100 foot dropoff where no wall is
needed.  Opening to the east is a beautiful view of the countryside.
20971.name: {cSa{ye{rrd{yo{cwn {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: The streets are overcrowded as the traffic from Net Street to the
south overflows into Snail Street, which starts here and heads north
through the heart of the Dock Ward.  This is one of the older wards in
the city, and the least upkept, as unpaved streets and decrepit
buildings accent the empire of seafaring that has kept the silver
coming in.  If one is in search of sea adventurer or a group to take
to the waters in piracy, this is the ward to scavenge through.  A
large storehouse stands to the west.
20750.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: The tracks of horses and other draft animals stitch across the road
in elaborate patterns, heading west and north.  This dirt packed road
is poorly kept and heavily traveled, though few others than the
caravans choose to venture it, so priority in its maintenance remains
a low priority for the city council.  To the north, a wide open area
can be seen, as the smell of animals lingers about--the courtyard
where the caravans commune with one another.
20627.name: {yCaravan {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: The west gates of the city lies here, tall and strong.  One would
expect these gates to be modest, given the protection the sea cliffs
offer to the city, however it is the storms as much as invaders that
Waterdeep must be weary of here.  The Westwall Street goes south along
the wall here, while Diamond Street leads east into the city.  Out the
gates the path leads down into the small beachfront that has developed
here.
20904.name: Within the {CG{cate{Cs {8of {BWa{bt{8e{wr{8d{be{Bep {8- {MW{mestgate{x

description: {c Though a large, open area was set aside for this Bazaar, it seems
not enough, as stalls sit lined side by side in great clumps and
people gather in great crowds about them.  The city watch is
everpresent here, though they prefer to stand outside of the Bazaar
circle and watch, which presents the opportunity for crime to occur
amidst the many distractions.  In many cases, the vendors are well
armed and there is little hesitation in taking the law into their own
hands if need be, despite there being strict laws in place for using
force against a wrong.  Here in the open market, things can quickly
get out of hand.  {x
20916.name: {3Eastern Bazaar Market{0

description: A slight bend in Immar Street follows the northern trollwall as it
curves along the northeast side.  Between the street and the walls are
somewhat smaller homes, no less elegant in design, but they stand as a
testament to harder times, when the northern trolls were a constant
threat to the city.  The thinking was that if homes be destroyed in
their siege, then let those closest to the walls go first--a sentiment
which echoes in the unusually tall walls erected about the narrow row
of homes against it.
20792.name: {8Immar {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: Dock street veers to the south and west here, as it follows the
gradual curve of the harbor.  Beneath the boardwalk, sea waves lap up
and spray the air in a salty mist that clings to clothing and burns
the eyes.  The warehouses and ship supply buildings along the
boardwalk here are weathered away from the wind, which blows
continuous day and night, winter or summer, for better or for worse.
To the east stand a sturdy building, unusually well-built considering
its locale.
20717.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: Deep ditches dig into the dirt of Coach Street, criss crossing and
gathering water as the daily rush of coach traffic utilizes this spot
daily.  The street ends and begins here, in a wide open cove designed
to manage the traffic, though the confusion of horse, person and coach
going this way and that makes it seem anything but organized.
Scarcely are people on foot here, as the many coaches would easily run
them down, and the piles of horse dung make traversing this road by
foot precarious.  To the east are rows upon rows of stables.
20680.name: {BC{boa{Bch Str{bee{Bt{x

description: This open area is filled with vendors selling all things related to
combat.  At the center, no stalls are setup, but rather there are
people of all look and profession, some sitting on heaps of gear, and
others standing with only the packs on their back.  Virgin's Square is
named from an old pagan myth that virgins were sacrificed on this
ground where dragons once gathered by their dens in Mount Waterdeep.
The tale takes hold of many imaginations, and this is a popular
meeting point for parties of all sort.  With the tale also is the
prosect of adventuring, and so Virgin's Square is also utilized by
mercenaries as a staging ground for exhibition, in hopes of being
hired to a job.  If one is in search of a worthy warrior to join them
in a quest, this is the place to look.
20800.name: {WV{wirgin's {YS{yquare{x

description: A smaller street juts from the main High Road, passing by several
quaint buildings on the edge of two wards which mark wealth and age to
the north, and the forbidden realms of death beyond the dark gates to
the south.  Just north of here stands a tall guildhall which
represents the trade of clerical arts, or formerly known as the House
of Healing.  There, one can hone their skills as a healer, engage in
stories concerning the arts of well being, or simply take in the
healing essences offered as a free service to anyone who wishes of it.
Further to the east Suldown turns a corner.
20989.name: {rS{wuldow{rn {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: Suldown follows the ominous skulled wall of the City of the Dead to
the south, as it journeys east to the Cliffwatch and west into the
City of Spendors.  A few modest buildings lie along the street, but
otherwise building here is restricted, both by the graveyard ward and
by the opening of the Cliffwatch where those with money and the homes
that lie to the west can sway building ordinances in favor of the
Suldown continues east and west.
20832.name: {rS{wuldow{rn {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: This unclean, noisy, crowded, gravel-packed dirt road is the prime
example of what the dock area is all about.  There is a dim haze of dust
that lingers in the air from the dirt that gets kicked up from all the
people and wagons passing by.  The building structures are mostly cheap
timber, and many of the buildings are rotting and patched with more wood to
prevent them from falling into a pile of firewood.  Every now and then there
is a stone structure seen looking as if its purpose is to just hold all the
shacks so that they don't collapse.  A rather peculiar looking shop lies to
the east.  It's hard to tell whether it looks different because it's
strange, or because it's just in better shape compare to the other timber
houses around the area.
20742.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: A crest of a shield with two longswords waves on banners that line
the sides of this wide, cobblestone street.  The mix of timber and two
story buildings clutter the sidewalks tightly cramping together
leaving no room for lurking alleyways.  A small musical shop lies to
the west, Warrior's Way continues north, and Waterdeep Way can be seen
directly to the south.
20890.name: {rW{Ra{wr{Wri{wo{Rr{r's {RW{Wa{wy{x

description: The distinct grey brick of Weeping Maiden's Run ends here to the
south, opening to another street.  There seems to be no rationale for
ending one street and starting another, save any official decree that
would establish boundaries for cross district trading and taxation.
Several tall brick buildings tower on either side of the street and
continue in this manner north and south.  To the south, Grocer's Lane
begins, while the Maiden's Run continues northward.
20663.name: {cW{Cee{cping {WM{wa{yide{wn{W's {GR{gun{x

description: {cThis open square marks the intersection of two major streets in
Waterdeep: Sul and Julthoon, though the merging is concealed by a
blanket of Bazaar commerce and people.  There is scarcely a straight
stretch across or through this area, making detours very lucrative for
those wishing to get to and fro in a hurry.  Many of the stalls seem
randomly placed, while others seem purposely planted in the middle of
the square, to force one to see it.  Though the rules of commerce are
highly regulated here, these regulations seem to blur on the edges as
vendors line up seemingly without rhyme or reason.  {x
20913.name: {3Northern Bazaar Market{0

description: {x
The street here is crowded, even more so than is typical for the High
Road, as many shops lie along the road in this ward aptly name trades
ward.  Most of the structures here are multi storied stone and timber
buildings with wide overhangs that jut out to the street as a service
to the citizens during Isthishia's rainfall bringings. Along the road
on both sides are placed a generous number of lamps that light up the
avenue at night and keep the guild of lamplighters in business, while
contributing to a health and full nightlife for the City of Spendors.{x
20794.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
Continuing its long run laterally through Waterdeep the High Road rises
gently upward as it ventures north along the eastern sloping reaches of
Mount Waterdeep, which can be easily seen towering to the northwest. An
incredible view of this road can be witnessed here looking northward as
it rises. A sea of people, carts and animals runs along its length, all
the way to the point where it levels off at the top of the plateau. The
sides of the road are staggered with storefront displays, street vendor
carts and broadsheet criers who operate on foot.  While much of traffic
continues down two streams, north and south, there are places where the
flow is interrupted either by an interesting site, or by merging crowds
in from an intersecting street. Not far south of here is Waymoot square.
20604.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: Wall Way curves and meanders about as it follows tightly the way of
the walls of the City of the Dead just east of here.  The city
ordinance which governed the establishment of streets and roads stated
the requirement that Wall Way remain one city lot away from the walls
of the graveyard, which it follows carefully, however there was no
requirement made that nothing else could be placed at the wall, and
thus was born a myriad of small buildings, kiosks, and vendor stalls.
To the south, a beautifully decorated guildhall stands adorned with a
sign depicting a lute and harp.
20820.name: {8Wall Way{x

description: {w
Here, the ground is barren, packed dirt. Not a single pave stone can be
found set about anywhere about this stretch of open space and in a city
where space is at a premium, this lot would normally fetch a high value
to those interested in developing it, however this is no ordinary court.
The Court of the White Bull holds a special place in Waterdhavian lore.
Named from a tavern which once stood here, the structure was leveled in
a great spell battle which was said to have tore a planar breach to the
Astral Plane.  Later this breach was purportedly repaired by Azuth, but
still to this day there are eddies of wild magic about, and a curse for
anyone wanting to build here--no permanent structure will survive here.{x
20932.name: {yCourt {8of the {WWhite Bull{x

description: Climbing down into an antechamber, is one room with two jakes that face
one another across a low 3-foot-high wall.  The rushing waters of the sewers
are very loud here, and closeby.
20854.name: {7The Washrooms{0

description: Skulls Street meets up with the northern wall of Waterdeep--this
area known affectionately as the Trollkill Walk.  Heavily fortified,
the trollwall here shows signs of an ancient moss covered base, upon
which is built countless levels of different stones spanning different
eras from which this wall was breached and repaired.  Today, little
threat remains of troll invasions, though the city guard maintains
their posts here and around the north walls, where tall guard towers
were erected to maintain peace.  The buildings which line this street
are tall, two story juggernauts which overtake the small plots that
each are built upon.  For many years following Waterdeep's turmoil
with the trolls, these plots were next to worthless--today they are
among the most sought after locales for anyone, as this area has
become an upper scale part of Waterdhaven society.
20963.name: {WSk{8u{Wlls {wS{8treet{x

description: {x                  {rRENT-A-BOAT{x
Dock street veers to the south and west here, as it follows the
gradual curve of the harbor.  Beneath the boardwalk, sea waves lap up
and spray the air in a salty mist that clings to clothing and burns
the eyes.  The warehouses and ship supply buildings along the
boardwalk here are weathered away from the wind, which blows
relentlessly day and night from the sea.  To the east stands a large
and unusually fit building, with large, double doors and a large sign
testifying to its use.  Dock Street continues west and south.
20720.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: Just off Waterdeep Way is the open square directly in front of the
government complex of the city, known traditionally as Piergeiron's
Palace, as named because it still serves as a residence for
Piergeiron--Waterdeep's first Lord.  The commons are heavily patrolled
by the city watch and guard, who both share in the duties here.  The
palace grounds are set behind tall iron gates, guarded continuously
and access inside is strictly prohibited.  Just behind the palace
rises Mount Waterdeep and beyond it the Sea of Swords.
20600.name: {cC{go{cmm{go{cns {xof {BPi{be{mr{Mgei{mr{bo{Bn's {MP{malace{x

description: This road is teeming with traffic, one can feet ahead of yourself.
This street holds many random shops and guilds along it's path and
connects to both entrances of the city of the dead graveyard just over
the wall northeast of here.  To the south a wonderful mix of spices
sharply tickles your nose coming from a small, black-brick shop.  The
road continues east and west.
20823.name: {8Wall Way{x

description: Two streets meet here: Sulmor which starts here and runs westward,
and Saerdown which follows the cliffwatch north and south.  Beautiful
homes line both sides of the street, their style distinctive to the
traditional styles of the city.  These are the homes of nobility, who
take up residence here in the north ward.  While the nobility class of
Waterdeep live elsewhere, most established families stay in this
district, known to be the safest, cleanest and wealthiest next to the
palace and castle grounds of course.  And here one gets a rare glimpse
of beauty from all fronts--the lavish villas and a breathtaking view
of the countryside to the east.
20972.name: {yS{wulmo{yr{x and {cSa{ye{rrd{yo{cwn {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: This avenue leads up to the castle, which sits at the base of Mount
Waterdeep, rising high to the west.  A long, meandering wall stands
terraced about the base of the mountain, behind which the castle and
supporting buildings stand.  The street is bustling, traffic flowing
in all directions and guards are heavily placed about, almost in an
oppressive manner.
20843.name: {mS{Moo{mths{Ma{myer's {BW{bay{x

description: The architecture takes on a distinctively middle class allure as
one heads north to south.  While due north, the style is artistically
classical, the buildings begin to change into more plain structures,
facilitating function over form.  A mixture of visible stone and wood,
and in some places, traditional thatched roofs make up much of these
latter styles.  The road here is paved in coarse stones and dirt,
packed firmly with excessive use.  Snail Street continues north and
south, through the heart of the Dock Ward.
20741.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: No matter what time of day or night it is, this place is crawling with
action!  There are groups of people everywhere, some gambling at tables,
others plying games of darts and strength, and as usual, a heavy crowd
waiting and watching for the occasional belly dancers that appear on stage.
20779.name: {&Back Room of the Sword's Rest{0

description: This long stretch of road rises gently northward as the landscape
bends to the whims of Mount Waterdeep to the northwest.  Many tall,
ornate buildings stand along both sides of the road, many open for
business.  Public works are all around this section of the city, from
fountains to benches, to trash barrels that are operated out of the
local guilds, Waterdeep City is oftentimes regarded as a model city
for how things should be handled.  Beneath the facade, there is
dangers and precarious forces in balance, that seek to overturn the
order and beauty that centuries of peace have forged.  The Way of the
Dragon Continues north and south.
20652.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: {8Shadows seem to reposition themselves as strange sounds echo from
dark corners.  The alley twists and turns between tall buildings and
its way is only evident from looking straight up and following the
crack of light that the sky brings to it.  A soft echoing of people
talking can be heard from the east wall, where there seems to be a
doorway.  Other than that, this spot is unsettlingly silent.  {x
20735.name: {gG{8ut All{gey{x

description: The finely paved street known as the Way of the Dragon continues
through the Southern Ward.  Much of the residential buildings here are
small squats or multi-storied apartments where living conditions are
less than ideal.  Buildings are old, but well maintained by its
residence, as the commoners who dwell here do so with a sense of
pride.  The streets are filled with travelers, carts, coaches and in
many places children who sit and people watch.  Apartment windows are
adorned with many colorful plants that catch the rainwater from the
roof, and wet clothing that hangs during the sunny afternoons.  The
pace here is fast, but not without a sense of courtesy as people move
out of the way of oncoming traffic.  The street continues east and
west, while to the north is a shop open for business.
20638.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: This stretch of loosely packed street is accented by scattered
cobblestones filled in with dirt.  As such, this road is in dire need
of maintenance, being heavily traveled from people to and from
Waterdeep's harbor.  Deep ruts cut through its surface, from between
the stones where stagnant puddles of muddy water sit and fester
diseases.  The buildings along this stretch are equally disarrayed,
fashioned of mostly wood, many are nothing more than termites holding
hands.  Here, an old, but nicely decorated building sits to the north.
A strong scent of perfume lingers in the air about it.
20711.name: {yN{we{yt {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: Some of the most lavish architecture in all the city reside along
this street, its name as solemn and inviting as the clean sidewalks
and neat kiosks which line them.  Commerce is highly regulated here,
as the old nobles prefer this remain a residential street, and any
trouble is frowned upon in this district.  Nearby, the sounds of many
people can be heard, beyond the Lion gate leading into the Field of
Triumph.  They are perhaps celebrating the recent emancipation of
Triboar to the north, which has for many years been at odds with
Waterdeep over trade dispute
20923.name: {yS{wtr{8ee{yt {xof the {MS{gi{Gngi{gn{Mg {CDolphin{x

description: Lavish temples lie scattered about, some built before this street
was established.  Each follows its own unique architectural style, and
many sects established throughout the realms model their churches
after these built in the City of Splendors.  The street itself does
not match any single temple style, but it does match the feeling of
reverence, paved here in dark onyx, which is kept very clean.
Delzorin continues east and west here, while intersecting with the
Singing Dolphin just west of here.
20935.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: This street is well kept, despite heavy traffic.  The stones are
cut slabs, worn smooth from daily use, deeply set as suggested by the
dark crevases that form between them.  Delzorin is frequented more by
those who make their pilgrimages to the nearby temples and shrines.
The lack of trade and commerce here results in a much cleaner part of
the city, and the magnificent temple architectures give this ward an
allure of inspiration.  Delzorin continues east and west, and just
east of here opens the busy High Road.
20949.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: The buildings along either side of the Way of the Dragon are well
established, brick and stone structures, some wood, but otherwise
fashioned of expensive materials.  They are diverse in styles and in
businesses, with shops, taverns, and several small inns operating out
of second floor stretches.  Looking at the many people who wander
along this expansive road, you notice that a great deal of them enter
and leave a large building a little further north along the road.
20756.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: {8This alleyway is wider than most, though much more twisted,
resembling a serpent.  The textured brick of the adjoining walls
appear as snake scales.  The moist dirt packed ground and foul smell
adds to the effect.  This Snake Alley continues to the west, opening
up to the bright and open Kerrigan's Court to the south.  {x
20669.name: {gS{cnak{ge {rA{8lle{ry{x

description: This large, wide street runs east to west connecting the high road
to the western side of waterdeep.  Many high, stylish looking
structures line this road, along with many temples that look like
masterpieces of art.  The street is made of onyx black cobblestone
which is neatly fitted together, making it easy to travel upon.  A few
lesser known shrines have been established here, owing to the lord's
decree that equal creedence be given to beneficial religions that are
not fully represented in Waterdeep.
20941.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: The sounds of the Bazaar can be heard just east of here, as
Julthoon Street continues east and west through Waterdeep.  The tall
buildings along either side of the street overshadow the bustle of
daily life below.  A few inviting anemities can be found scattered
throughout--a bench, a bright streetlamp, and a trash barrel, though
not as many people use the latter as would be hoped.  A few vendors
are set up about here, but mostly commerce is confined to the central
Bazaar, or to the trades ward further east near the City of the Dead.
20911.name: {!Julthoon Street{0

description: A large avenue cuts through the city of Waterdeep west to east.
This street, known as Julthoon connects the main artery of the city,
the High Road just east of here, to the bustling Bazaar at the center
of the City of Splendors, through to such sights as Khelben's black
tower and the great colliseum on the western edge of the city.
Buildings here are mostly stone with some wood, all large and old,
having been firmly established in the heart of the city.  Though a bit
of a relief from the bustling High Road, this street is still one of
the busiest in town.
20919.name: {!Julthoon Street{0

description: This narrow road butts against the sign decorated storefronts and
the impending walls of the City of the Dead directly east of here.
The shops spill out into the streets as peddlers, both licensed and
illicit, shout and dazzle passerbys with their wares.  To the west is
a small store made of stone, looking very bright and clean unlike most
nearby.  Just north of here is the Coffinmarch - the main walkway to
the graveyard.
20826.name: {8Wall Way{x

description: Probably once a long dark alley, this street has been poorly turned
into a commercial walkway.  The road is an interesting mix of dirt,
cobblestone, and gravel randomly spread along the street - probably
created from the scraps and leftovers from other roads.  The borders
of the street are lined with the backs of tall stone buildings while
there are occasional commercial building entrances up and down the
road.  To the north is an old wooden tattered warehouse.
20754.name: {RS{yl{cu{yt {wSt{8r{cee{wt{x

description: Two large iron gates stand closed here with guards of the watch posted
to uphold Waterdeep's ordinance that no one be allowed within the City
of the Dead after hours. The gates are blackened iron, reddened with a
layer of rust in patches and secured upon two massive stone pillars on
which are carved the likeness of skulls and bones. The wall around the
City of the Dead is tall and crowned with iron spikes, deterring those
who would seek to break the curfew.  The Coffinmarch is west from here.{x
20736.name: The {mWest {WGates {xto the {8C{ri{8ty of the D{re{8ad{x

description: This small aromatic shop deals with with a wide variety of
pipeweed, tobacco, and snuff which has been imported and collected
from all over the realms The lighting is unfortunately very poor here
though, so one would need to get very close to the sale items to see
exactly what is for sale.
20624.name: {&Downybeard {3Tobacconist{0

description: Nearby, the lapping waves of the sea rise up on the piers which
support the long expanse of boardwalk.  Along the shore are numerous
docks, built up to moor the many sea vessels which come to port here.
Looking closely at the docks, several are floating, as the deep water
makes securing them to the sea floor very difficult, and as such these
floating docks are not suitable for mooring large ships.  For those
that are free standing, there are many large horns for tieing the
mooring ropes.  The street here is half loose paved rocks and half
coarsely cut timbers, as the ground beneath drops to the sea.  Large
ruts are carved into the wood, and in spots between wood and dirt,
making Dock Street somewhat inhospitable to travelers.
20721.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: {x
Carts and wagons take over the road here as they fight for priority in
passing through the big city of Waterdeep. The High Road was and still
remains the primary artery for trade and traffic.  Several shops stand
along the sides of the road, set within large, multi storied buildings
that are partitioned into smaller squares.  Though traditionally those
shops which do business along the busiest road tends to get the lion's
share of profits, such is no guarantee in Waterdeep, where many of the
most popular and successful shops do business well off the beaten path.{x
20793.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: Along both sides of the street are many signs and peddlers,
cementing the namesake of this ward to its purpose.  The roads are
well-traveled throughout, and here at the shadows of the City of the
Dead, the sounds of commerce is everywhere.  It is hard to imagine the
dead not thinking what a trifle life can be, being within earshot of
the hagglers and bargain seekers who fill the air with banter.  Wall
Way continues to trace the walls of the graveyard, traversing east and
west here.
20822.name: {8Wall Way{x

description: The street widens into, appropriately enough, a square elongated on
two opposite corners, or more commonly known as the shape of a
diamond.  At the far apex stands a grand spiraling tower, reminiscent
of a stack of coins, rising high into the sky.  To the south is a wide
temple, fashioned of bluish granite and adorned with the symbol of
nine stars encircling a flame.  This area, known by Waterdhavens as
the city's Temple Diamond District, is elegant in designs.  One of
every popular deity is represented along the raised terrace wall that
separates the street from the garden lawns about the two temples,
offering a feeling of neutrality here, where without it would seem
burdening.  Diamond Street ends and begins here, running west while to
the north runs Delzorin Street.
20655.name: {WD{Yi{xa{Wm{Yo{xn{Wd {YS{xt{Wr{Ye{xe{Wt{x

description: Fish Street continues here, cutting narrowly across the dilapidated
buildings of the Dock Ward.  Most here are storehouses, with only back
doors and service entrances facing to this street.  The great Sea of
Swords lies just to the west, dropping gradually down as many
centuries of work has built the coastline up to almost level with the
rest of Waterdeep.  The smell of sea mist lingers in the air.  To the
south is a metalsmith shop.
20729.name: {cF{wis{ch {yStr{wee{yt{x

description: This large, dirt packed T-intersection is the basis of where the
wooden docks start, and is a usual delivery route where shipments go
in and out for trade.  The sound of the waves are easily heard from
here as they crash against the underside of the docks and beaches
closeby.  To the north is snail street, and the actual docks start to
the west.
20712.name: {yN{we{yt {xat {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: At the docks of waterdeep the wild sea of swords crashes violently
against the dock pillars that hold up the wooden boardwalk you stand
upon now.  Just outside of the docks is the harbor of waterdeep, and
within it are trading ships and many of the guard fleets sailing the
wild waters.  The docks continues at a twisting path, outlining the
edge of the coast, where land meets water.  Many people walk to and
fro, hauling their baggage and large carts filled with cargo.  Ships
continually unload and load, so there are few hours where things do
not seem hectic here.
20713.name: {yN{we{yt {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: {8Here begins a dark and unhospitable stretch of alley that cuts
northward between the shore facing buildings and the storefronts along
Snail Street.  Trash lies everywhere, scarcely leaving room to walk,
as this alley is used primarily for disposing of unwanted things.  The
smells of rotten fish lingers as steam rises from nearby sewage
drains.  Lighting is next to none as the way north disappears into the
shadows.  To the south runs Fish Street.  {x
20732.name: {gG{8ut All{gey{x

description: The moorbells of docking ships sound across the hollowed alleyways
between the tall, timbered buildings.  The dirt swirls in
intersections, reminiscent of the poor conditions of the road, as well
as the amount of use they get.  This street is one of the major
avenues for the dockworkers and couriers who move goods off the ships
to shops and warehouses throughout the city.  Some goods go straight
from the cargo hull to the cart and off to the far reaches of the
realms as traders and merchants seek that glimmer of gold just beyond
the horizon.
20739.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: East is city of dead gates The stones which pave the Coffinmarch
are dark riverstones, which are naturally smooth, but chillingly they
now sit highly polished and rounded from centuries of funerary
traffic.  Directly east of here stand the west gates to the City of
the Dead, which are the main gates into the graveyard enclosure, and
the only official entryway through which the dead are brought.  The
avenue narrows on its approach to the graveyard, symbolic of the
desire for low numbers entering the final resting place for the city's
passing.
20827.name: {8The {RCo{rff{8inm{rar{Rch{x

description: Coach Street continues east and west here amidst the fast paced
running of the coaches.  Though not amendable to heavy foot traffic,
this street does have a few notable sites for travelers, though much
of the business here is catered to locals.  The buildings here and
elsewhere in the south ward are simple stone and timber, plain in
appearance and very functional, often packing dozens of tenants per
floor.  A sign stands here designating the area to the north as the
"Adventurer's Ward" while the street sign refers to it as Kerrigan's
Court.
20675.name: {BC{boa{Bch Str{bee{Bt{x

description: The sounds of the sea can be heard not far to the west, as just
beyond the narrow line of buildings, the western trollwall gives way
