to the Sea of Swords.  This part of Waterdeep City is known
collectively as the Sea Ward, based on its proximity to the sea,
though many have come to refer to it as the Temple Ward, or the Ward
of Nobles, as many prominent families call this place home.  The
Street of Silks continues north and south, while to the east lies a
shop filled with an assortment of items of all needs and tastes.
20879.name: The {mStr{Wee{mt of S{Wi{mlks{x

description: Continuing north and south is Snail Street, as the swiftness by
which people pass two and fro give rise to questions regarding the
origin of this street's name.  Perhaps it is not the traffic it
describes as much as the people: apathetic, dirty faces stare out from
street corners, as the lower class lull away the afternoon.  Many
spend their shifts at harbor or even out at sea, fishing and careering
one of the several hundred vessels that utilize Waterdeep's well
equipped harbor.  Much of the city's industry is spawned from the sea,
as is much of the city's noxious smells that drift with the winds,
especially in the late afternoon.
20747.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: {3The larger tapestry has a {Bblue{3 field with a {1red griffon{3 rampant, and
the smaller tapestry shows the {8silhouette{3 of a sailing ship.  {0
This is a quiet tavern with a small collection of tables, benches, and
mismatched stools for its patrons.  Most of the tables have elaborate
carvings in their surfaces from the daggers of past patrons - there might
even be some messages left within the general scrawls and carvings of
useless graffiti.  Its only light filters in through filthy windows during
the day, a tallow candle chandelier providing light at night.  The back wall
is decorated with some tapestries which most likely hung in a noble villa
once, but are now so threadbare and stained by smoke and spilled ale that
they are nearly worthless.  The washrooms are accessed by two ladders in the
floor, while stairs lead up to a few bedrooms and a party room.
20776.name: {3T{#h{3e {#T{3h{#i{3r{#s{3t{#y {3T{#h{3r{#o{3a{#t{0

description: {m
The shop here is extremely clean and tidy not like most stores which
operate in the Trade Ward. Four torches line each wall of this store
making it almost too bright for the inside of a building. Where bare
walls would be hang some of the most detailed paintings depiciting a
glimpse of city life - an indoor scene of merrymakers indulging at a
spot called the Thirsty Throat, a tall colorful painting of the Bell
Tower near Castle Waterdeep, which is painted in the background, and
a depiction of the Yawning Portal Inn, one of Waterdeep's oldest inn
and tavern.  One would think this an art gallery, but at the counter
are piled many catalogs of all the many shops and sites in Waterdeep.{x
20811.name: {MA{murora's {BR{bealms {GS{ghop {WC{wounter {cat {8Tusks{x

description: The street is part land, part boardwalk, as thick timbers pave the
otherwise precarious drop down to the sea.  Deep ruts have been gouged
out of the timbers, as carts and wagons have taken their toll on them.
The great Sea of Swords opens to the west, spanning as a mighty field
of deep blue, interrupted by a long stretch of sea wall encircling the
harbor.  Along the land side of the street are many buildings, mostly
storehouses and private facilities, offering no hospitality to
seafarers looking for a place to feel at home.  For them, Waterdeep
offers much in the way of enjoyment, though further within the Dock
Ward to the east.  The street continues along the harbor and the rows
upon rows of docks.
20723.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: Decorating the walls and tables of this small shop are countless numbers
of a variety of stringed instruments.  Each instrument has a special shine
and glow to them that makes them look better than any other instrument could
ever match.  If one was lookin for any kind of stringed instrument ever
made, this shop is sure to have it.
20902.name: {2Musical {#L{3u{#t{3e{#s {2and {^H{6a{^r{6p{^s{0

description: {3Large chunks of wood litter the floor here of a once flourishing
home - now a small shack inhabited by small rodents and other street
animals.  The sections of the house that still stand seem to be on
their last life due to the rain that has pitted the store and rotted
the wood.  {0
20991.name: {$Abandoned House{0

description: The River Gate opens here, spanning across two massive gate doors,
reinforced with hardened iron.  Used almost exclusively by the river
traders, these gates at one time represented a weak link in the city's
defenses, as raiding parties floated down the river and ambushed the
unsuspecting guards, causing a short-lived, though realistic danger to
the ci In response, the gates are closed at night, open only by
request to late traveling ferrymen who are familiar to the guards.
Even with such precautions, danger still exists, though the prospect
of enduring a large scale invasion from the river is faint to none.
20785.name: Within the {CG{cate{Cs {8of {BWa{bt{8e{wr{8d{be{Bep {8- {wT{8he {cR{Ci{cv{Ce{cr {CG{ca{Ct{ce{x

description: Many of the buildings here are wood, with some stone sparsely
placed as foundation holders.  In places such as the Trade Ward, stone
foundations are common, and often sport a clean wash of color to
brighten up the look.  Here, the stones are locally scavenged from the
sea, sporting the look of dried barnacles and thick moss that gives it
anything but a look of brightness.  The timbers are darkened,
suggested they spent many months in water as the northeastern lumber
yards float them down the Dessarin.  Some sport layers of oozing pitch
to prevent rot, but not all, as some have already rotted near clean
through.  A strange odor of rot and fish lingers in the air.  To the
west stands a somewhat nicer building, most likely used for cargo
storage.
20748.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: A beautiful view of the western half of the city can be seen here.
Mount Waterdeep rises along the right, while below it sits the likes
of Waterdeep Castle and Piergeiron's Palace.  A clean line traces from
the castle to a large circle in the street, offset by many squares
littered about.  Another oval shaped open area seems to move by
itself, as masses of people gather in the Bazaar to trade and
interact.  A large mage's tower blocks the view to the far left, where
the mooring bells can be heard.  Far to the right, elegant temple
complexes rise above noble villas.
20993.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: Suldown makes a sharp turn here, as it traverses several old
buildings that resided here when the street was just a cutthrough.
The street is narrow, and there is scarcely a sidewalk to traverse, as
people walk out among the carts and beasts that travel much slower
than the likes of Dolphin or the High Road, making such a move safe.
Along the northern half of the street are quaint apartments and half
villas, rented and owned by the lesser nobility, though still a castle
to a commoner.  The windows facing southward are few, and those that
exist are shaded and kept shut.  Along the southern edge is a wall
adorned with bones and skulls, black iron and aged timbers.  A wall
barring two worlds, and segregating the mystery that is death to the
innocence of the city.
20967.name: {rS{wuldow{rn {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: {8The narrow alley affectionately called Gut Alley meanders through
warehouse junctions as it makes its way through much of Waterdeep's
most forgettable locales.  {8This narrow run affectionately called Gut
Alley meanders through warehouse junctions as it makes its way through
much of Waterdeep's most forgettable locales.  Trash barrels lie
scattered about, spilling out into stagnant puddles of water,
strangely looking like backed up sewage.  The smells are wildly
nautious, and there is a feeling of uneasyness about here as eyes
stare out from the shadows.  {x
20733.name: {gG{8ut All{gey{x

description: Coach Street continues east and west here, emerging from a large
intersection with it and the High Road just to the east.  Tall
buildings line the streets, offering services ranging from smithing to
cleaning, though none but the unlearned traveler actually patronizes
the business which boast the most flashy show of their store fronts.
To learned Waterdhavens, it is the peddler on the street, or the back
of the cart vendor that offers the best wares at competitive prices.
Low overhead as someone once called it, as oftentimes their makeshift
shops are converted storage units, where ceiling heights are at a
minimum to maximize total rentable units.
20674.name: {BC{boa{Bch Str{bee{Bt{x

description: {8Oddly enough, after seeing how lavishly pronounced the rest of this
tower is, this room is complete bare..  {0
20953.name: {5Bedroom{0

description: Sulmor ends just west of here, at Sul Street, making way for a
monumental temple complex built across the road, and well before this
street had been established by the council of elders in Waterdeep's
youth.  Remnants of the ancient times are still visible in moss
covered rocks that jut from the ground--old foundations long ago razed
by trolls and rebuilt to withstand their attacks.  The paving of the
main road is much newer, less than a century, as evident by the still
jagged edges on some stones.  On both sides of the street, tall villas
and spired temples spill out almost to the sidewalk.
20888.name: {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: {x
The High Road cuts through the heart of the Trades Ward of Waterdeep as
evident by the many caravaneers and carts which traverse this locale in
heavy numbers. This ward is represented by modestly sized buildings, of
simple brick, stone and wood. Most all businesses here harbor the sales
of goods and services, those along this High Road are especially flashy
for those who pass by. There is also several taverns and inns which can
be found in this district, most are competitively priced with the basic
accomidations and offer a haven from the rustle and bustle of city life.
To the east runs an old dirt packed road where the caravans come and go
in large numbers.  A placemarker brands this road as leading to Caravan
Court, where the caravan merchants gather to exchange goods and gossip.{x
20619.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: You walk into a high ceiling building, separated by a vast open
area from entrance to end.  Robed scholars walk about talking and
comparing writings and ideas, while along the walls several apprentice
scriveners attend to their daily lessons.  Several squared support
pillars divide the room roughly into thirds, reserving the largest
divide to the center area.  Many artistic renderings and calligraphy
of ancient mottos hang about the pillars and side walls.  The most
striking and quizzical feature of all is the blank wall that stands
two stories across the room, at the far end.  Several occular openings
illuminate the wall, which appears as a smooth, barren slab of stone.
Many people about marvel and point at it as if they see something in
it, yet it appears there is nothing there.
20881.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: Carts, and horses are constantly being rounded up here, and being
transfered in and out of the palace stables due west of the court.  The
buildings here are quite large, and seem to be connected to the palace.  To
the east is some large iron fencing glowing magically warding and pushing
away anyone who comes close to it.  Beyond the fencing is a large, deep red
tower mysteriously pulsating something that makes your skin tingle.
20874.name: {cF{we{ctl{wo{cck {gCourt {xat the {mStr{Wee{mt of S{Wi{mlks{x

description: {x
This high traffic road is lined with majestic architecture ranging from
timber and wattle-and-daub to solid stone structures. All buildings in
this ward are at least two stories high, most are between two and three
and a select few are in excess of five stories. Numerous signs reach to
the streets from the buildings, demanding the attention of the many who
pass this way in hopes of luring them inside. To the west is a big shop
from whence the sound of hammering metal can be heard. In the window is
perhaps the most elegant set of armor you have ever seen--richly ornate
in precious metals and stones and glowing with a seemingly magical aura.
20807.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: Along the bustling road of the Dragon, a large path leads east to a 3
story high building called the Yawning Portal Inn.  The walls are made of
brick and look very faded due to their ancient age.  Comparing it to other
buildings around, you can tell this Inn has been around for a long time.
The road continues north and south from here and just up ahead to the north
you can see a road breaking off to the west.
20757.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: The roadway is well maintained here and throughout the Castle Ward,
despite the heavy traffic it endures.  This is due in part to the
importance of these roads to the governing structure of the city,
though their proximity to the pavers and masons guilds also play a
role in their quick maintenance.  The buildings which line the streets
are two and three story structures, of quaint architectural styles
fashioned primarily of stone, also do to the closeness to the masons.
Waterdeep Way continues east and west.
20862.name: {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep {yWay{x

description: {DCity of the Dead graveyard to the north{x
This narrow road is known as Sleeper's Walk, for some because the
flow of traffic comes to near a halt as one approaches the City of the
Dead.  To a select few, it is a place where enchantment takes hold and
forces unsuspecting victims into a slumber, where later they are moved
to the graveyard, their valuables taken.  For the most part, this is a
safe area, as there are numerous people around at all hours of the day
and the city watch patrols it heavily.  A vibrantly colored shop lies
to the east, while a main artery of Waterdeep opens to the south.
20789.name: {cSl{yee{cp{ye{cr's {wW{ca{8l{wk{x

description: This large armory contains any kind of forged, metal armor, and by
the looks of the designs and 'show armor' mounted on the walls, it
looks to be quite well done.  The craftmanship of the few armor pieces
on display looks very good, though the durability of these pieces
cannot be gauged by sight alone.
20858.name: The {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad {RA{rrmory{x

description: This large, wide street runs east to west connecting the high road to the
western side of waterdeep.  Many high, stylish looking structures line this
road, along with many temples that look like masterpieces of art.  The
street is made of onyx black cobblestone which is neatly fitted together,
making it easy to travel upon.
20947.name: {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: Warrior's Way cuts through the center of Waterdeep, north and south
through the district of warriors, mercenaries, and weapons masters of
all kind.  Along the road are many private guilds dedicated to near
every weapons trade known, most reputable, but many operating beneath
the streets, under the cloak of darkness.  Though the city watch keeps
close eye on these suspected dark guilds, they are for the most part
left to mingle with the rich diversity of the city.  Harmless or not,
it is understood that given a long enough building of power, all such
places of unrest will eventually take their battles to the foot of
immortals, where the true balance of powers are rechecked.  A few
private storage houses line this particular section of the street.
20892.name: {rW{Ra{wr{Wri{wo{Rr{r's {RW{Wa{wy{x

description: The street narrows as it curves about several tall buildings on
either side.  Resembling almost an alley here, the guild of
lamplighters ensures the safety of Waterdhavens by posting lamps at
every few paces, keeping even the moonless night at bay.  A large
tower structure rises to the east, while along the north and west are
smaller buildings, only a couple of stories, but still among the
largest in the city.  Backs turned to this street, most of the
impressive style is reserved for the other sides, though there still
repeats here the same patterns that are indicative of master work.
The checkered walk of Diamond Street continues east and south of here.
20649.name: {WD{Yi{xa{Wm{Yo{xn{Wd {YS{xt{Wr{Ye{xe{Wt{x

description: This large warehouse probably toweres about thirty feet high, but due to
the lack of light that even your light source emits, you cannot really tell.
It is however, tightly stocked by numerous crates of all sizes and looks
like it is used for storage.  Oddly though, each crate looks to be in mint
condition and each one is stamped with the name of "Bellister" upon them.
Besides the crates, nothing else inhabits this warehouse - aside from the
occasional mouse and dusty floors of course.
20698.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: This open, packed dirt courtyard is a general assembling area for
caravans.  Many draft animals and caravan drivers rest here for short
breaks from the road.  Here, the road dead ends against the eastern
city wall.  You notice many people standing or lounging against the
wall, engaged in some sort of game.  This is the northeast corner of
the courtyard, which is a rather dark and dingy area where some
colorful characters congregate.  Caravan Court continues southwest
from here.
20622.name: {yCaravan {YC{yourt{x

description: {x
All around are tall ornate walls and the richly spired buildings that
sit behind them, just out of reach from anyone who is not a member of
the right guild, or who knows the right kind of people to gain access
to them. They look as inaccessible also with not a smear of a child's
hand marring the bright marble surfaces, or the lackluster appearance
of an inviting bench for citizens to rest awhile. Many of these walls
hole away the homes of nobility which in turn hide clandestine guilds
that one either has to be born into or spend many years in service of
in order to even get a glimpse at what happens behind them shut doors.
20950.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: The simple, wood and stone buildings here are the modest living
quarters of Waterdeep's working class.  Many are employed at the
docks, where some live, though a move to the Southern Ward is a step
up from the crime stricken likes of the harbor district.  Metal bars
are built into several of the windows of shops, though few tenants can
afford them on their small apartments, which are often the target of
burgulary.  A few of these buildings are family owned, and some sport
bright colors that accentuate the otherwise dull walk of the Way of
the Dragon.  The street continues here to the east and northward down
a straight cut through the center of Waterdeep.
20643.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: Pools of water lie stagnant in deeply carved ruts along the dirt
packed street.  The constant traffic of wheeled carts takes its toll
on the infastructure daily.  This section of street is especially busy
with a major intersection lying west of here and the Adventurer's Ward
a short distance east.  Short multistoried buildings stand along both
sides of the street.  They are old, but structurally in decent looking
condition and would best be described as plain in style.
20678.name: {BC{boa{Bch Str{bee{Bt{x

description: Kerrigan's Court ends here as numerous businesses open out to the
street.  To the east towers the Safehaven Inn, a popular inn and
tavern for those seeking a haven from dangers.  To the south is an old
stone two-story building, home to one of Waterdeep's more infamous
broadsheets.  It is constantly in need of cleaning due to the
dissenting opinions of the public with their rotten eggs and
vegetables.  Otherwise, the street looks quite clean, continuing here
to the east.  To the north opens a somewhat wide alley between two
tall buildings that many people seem to take advantage of as a cut
through.
20670.name: {MK{me{rr{8ri{rg{ma{Mn's {BCourt{x

description: The wind between buildings can clearly be heard here, partly due to
the high plateau which makes up the cliffwatch to the east, and partly
due to the silence abound in this part of the city.  The local
nobility which live here are of the older generation, sometimes more
respected than "new money" but always given the best that Waterdeep
has to offer in terms of accomidations, tax breaks, and amenities.
These villas are strikingly beautiful, some almost gaudy in their
design, but all of them are interesting to gaze upon in this stretch
of street.  Saerdown street intersects to the south, while Immar
continues northward.
20929.name: {8Immar {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: {&G{7li{&tt{7er{&i{7ng{0 and {#*{0sparkling{#*{0 glass overtakes your sight when looking
around this store.  Dangling from all sides of the ceiling are
examples of the glassword done here, and along the shelves lie some
nicely glazed mugs and bowls for eating and drinking.  The torches
here seem to be positioned in just the right places of the store to
help the items give off their maximum {7glow{0 and {#shine{0.
20834.name: {CGlass {xand {WGl{wazi{Wng {GShop{x

description: The impending sea laps up from beneath the boardwalk, as crusts of
salt coat the timbers in an almost weathering appeal.  The great
Deepwater Harbor lies to the south, where the harbor wall encloses a
countless clustering of sea vessels, large and small of every shape
and decor.  Far out at sea, one can see the great Deepwatch Isle
tower, used to keep watch over the harbor, and several lesser towers
and lighthouses running the course of the wall.  A thick mist lingers
in the air, as the sea brings with the day a sense of mystery.  Dock
Street continues east and west, while to the north is a popular
tavern, where many visitors and old timers converge.
20726.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: {x
Along the busy avenues of the high road, people take the streets by the
swarms leaving very little room to walk comfortably. Their only concern
seems to be the faster passing carts that would run them down otherwise.
To the west is a large magical looking building devoted to some sort of
important group. The east is segregated by an ominous wall behind which
is a partially restricted place. On the wall are painted the likenesses
of bones and skulls and symbols of death, home of the City of the Dead.
20809.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
Along the course of the High Road one will encounter almost everyone of
note, from broadcryers to amateur magic entertainers and tricksters and
an abundance of local flavor. The lax rules of social interaction makes
for varied companies as drunks and nobles can be seen walking alongside
one another though rarely engaged in any interaction. The buildings are
short, simple squarish structures made of wood and stone and lacking in
any ornate details.  Here in the south ward of the city, most buildings
serve as shops on the lower levels and densely packed apartments on the
uppers.  Just about anything can be found along this road, from taverns
and inns, to food vendors and shops peddling the latest in exotic goods.
The High Road continues its north south cut through the city while just
to the east lies an arched door marked "Beware Guardian Monsters Within".
20610.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: This small shop has a pleasant, perfume-like smell to it.  Part of
the shop is curtained off, presumably someone's living area.  Many
flowers both live and dried are placed all about as a kettle of liquid
steams in the corner.  At the front counter, a nice variety of finely
made dyes are on display.
20997.name: The {RH{ro{Bu{ms{Me {xof {MD{my{re{Rs{x

description: Caravan Court extends here to the northeast, across an open yard of
packed dirt and crowds of traders.  Among the crowds here are carts,
wagons, beasts of burden, and traders representing just about every
civilized race you can think of.  Long before the city council
officially recognized this Court, it was established as a meeting
place for caravans to discuss trade routes and exchange their goods
with one another to maximize their profits.  So rooted was this place
in their lifestyle, and so dependent was it on Waterdeep's economy,
that every attempt made to develop this land into something else
failed, be it by unyielding city officials, or the mysterious deaths
of the developers.  Caravan Court continues east and north from here.
To the south runs the Caravan Street.
20626.name: {yCaravan {YC{yourt{x

description: This short, and narrow road is constructed of a cobblestone base,
and the surrounding buildings are mostly made of timber.  The street
is noticebly not very well kept due to the garbage found frequently
littering the corners of where the buildings meet the road.  A
brightly lit shop is to the west with large, glass window panes.
Inside the glass windows hang some uniquely made glass sculptures, as
well as some other useful glass materials.  To the north, the street
leads to Waterdeep's graveyard, while to the east a small walk leads
to an open area.
20814.name: {cSl{yee{cp{ye{cr's {wW{ca{8l{wk{x

description: This gigantic stable houses all the horses and other ridden animals that
are used by the keepers of Waterdeep Castle.  Large wooden beams make up the
supports for this place, and the floor has been covered with hay to make up
for the lack of carpentry.  To the west are the actual stabled where the
prize kingdom horses are tended to daily and most likely given better
treatment than the peasants of the city.
20906.name: {3Palace Stables{0

description: Julthoon opens into a T intersection, as the Street of Silks begins
south on its run down the length of Waterdeep.  Fewer temples lie in
the southern half of this ward, as ornate buildings vacate the
mystical for the more mundane.  Cathedrals make way for castles, as
Waterdeep's governing body lies south and west in the palace complex
just at the base of Mount Waterde east leads back to the central
bazaar, west to the Street of the Singing Dolphin and further to the
great arena of the city, where the bravest warriors battle one another
for honor.
20909.name: {!Julthoon Street{0

description: The name of this street seems a contradiction, as noisy crowds
criss cross here and there across the gravel-packed dirt.  Trash lies
all about, gathering at the bases of waste cans and lamp posts, and
trampled into the dirt.  Buildings are short and simple, mostly wood
and straw.  Several shops can be seen every few buildings, selling
items of utility, such as rope nets, steering oars, and thatching
materials.  Others sell food items in an open market style, many
fished from the sea and fresh off the boat.  Snail Street continues
north and south through the Dock Ward, while to the west a street
leads out to the docks.
20731.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: The black stones of this road have been polished to a dull shine
from the many centuries of foot traffic it has endured.  Rounded on
the edges, it takes the likeness of cobblestones, though the
distinctive stone is reminiscent of black granite from the n The area
here is peacefully quiet, unlike most all the rest of the city, and
many centuries of age has formed it into a haven for the young and old
to play and retire to.  The black street continues east and west
loosely following the Trollwall to the north.
20957.name: {WSk{8u{Wlls {wS{8treet{x

description: One of the trophies here is an award for 'most moving voice' from the
concert at the Plinth 5 years ago.
One of the paintings is of the famous bard chorus of the Olamn school,
while another is of a soloist playing at Waterdeep Castle.
This grand sized house contains pieces of history everywhere within its
walls through the paintings mounted along the walls and the display cases
lined with trophy after trophy.  All the pieces on display seem to relate to
song and prose of past events throughout the city.
20995.name: {RUNUSED

description: The road here is degrading, as much of the loosely packed gravel
and stone has fallen to large heaps alongside the road.  There is a
dim haze of dust that perpetually hangs about from all of the people
and wagon traffic.  Buildings here are mostly made of low quality
timbers, harvested from the nearby forests where logging is still
permitted.  The occasional building made of stone can be seen
scattered amidst rows and rows of wood.  A dark, narrow alley lies to
the west, and across from it a nondescript shop has taken up business.
Snail Street continues north and south.
20740.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: {7The wooden floors and walls creak as the wind from the nearby ocean s
waves blows up against this large home.  Along the east and west walls where
torch light prevails, a few minature models of great ships have been bottled
in glass jugs and set onto display tables as prize collections.  There is
also a large table set here in the center of the room which is around 6 feet
in diameter.  It must be used a lot for gatherings due to the numerouse
etchings and stains on its surface.{0
20770.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: {x
The hustle and bustle of the High Road makes for an adventure in and of
itself, attracting many to its luster while driving away those who seek
a slower pace in their daily grind. The roadway is wide - allowing room
for four wagons side by side. The surface is worn, but even having been
fashioned from thick riverstone and dug deep into the ground. Along the
stretch of road are many streetlamps to keep this place going all hours
day and night. The buildings which lie alongside the High Road here are
primarily multi-storied, wood and stone, simplistic in style and old in
appearance. Clothing hands from lines stretching across narrow alleyway
and from window to window, where many potted plants sit in the sunlight
hinting that the upper floors of these buildings are mainly residential.
20612.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: The deep grey bricks of the road here are jagged and coarse, and
follow no distinct pattern of placement along its route.  The street
is narrow and large brick buildings tower around you making it hard to
see what fortunes the sky might hold on such a day.  Foot traffic is
moderate here, increasing in density as one approaches a large open
area to the east.  To the west, the run leads out onto the Way of the
Dragon.
20658.name: {cW{Cee{cping {WM{wa{yide{wn{W's {GR{gun{x

description: This small shop is full of all kinds of hats for all occasions.
The majority of the hats sit on tall wooden beams with hooks randomly
placed around them to show off a nice display, while some hats have
been lined along wooden shelves which form the aisles of the store.
20903.name: {CE{Bl{Me{cg{Ra{Bn{Ct {yHead{Wwear{x

description: The upper floor of the Gentle Mermaid is a vast gambling hall, full
of the lights and sounds of machines, card dealers and dice.  Several
dozen round tables are lined up across the floor, which wraps around
an open balcony overlooking the main floor below.  Here one can take
to a game of cards and watch people enter the Gentle Mermaid at the
same time, while enjoying a home brew.
20980.name: {xThe {GG{ga{ym{Ybl{yi{gn{Gg {WPa{wvi{8l{wli{Won{x

description: Half of the room on this floor is occupied by empty space from which a
chandelier has been tied and hung onto the floor railing.  On the rest of
this floor are three open room, two looking to be guest rooms, while the
thirs is a large meeting/party room from which patrons rent out for special
occasions.
20867.name: {32{#n{3d {#F{3l{#o{3o{#r {3o{#f {3t{#h{3e {#T{3h{#i{3r{#s{3t{#y {3T{#h{3r{#o{3a{#t{0

description: {x
The fast moving wagons and horses make foot travel precarious along the
High Road, which serves both as a major connect point for Waterdhavians
as well as an important trade route for caravans traveling from town to
town. While other roads run parallel to this one, the High Road remains
the heaviest used of all roads in the city. As such there are many inns,
taverns, and shops to be seen along its length, and while discounts are
not their defining characteristic, good service and wide selections are.
For those seeking convenience, their path need not stray from this road,
as everything can be found alongside it.  To the east, an inviting shop
displaying all manner of potent potables lies ready to serve the public.
20613.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: This patch of wide road marks the beginning of Snail Street at the
north.  The stones paved here are massive, and well worn, as this
serves as one of the major routes to Castle Waterdeep to the
southwest.  The elegance and somewhat excessive architecture is
characteristic of the Castle Ward, and marks some of the most
beautiful scenery in all of the city.  Far to the west are the castle
gates and rising high above in the distance is Castle Waterdeep, built
alongside the steep slope of the mountain.
20841.name: {ySn{Yai{yl {mStr{ree{mt{x

description: This modest street continues north and south along the west wall of
the city.  Not much scenery is abound here, as many of the buildings
face the main avenues, showing much less detail to this street.  These
are where the back doors are, where nobles can step out a moment and
perhaps catch a fresh breeze and sea mist beyond the west gates.  The
occasonal person can be seen walking through, otherwise it is very
quiet here.
20901.name: {MW{mest{Rw{rall {GS{gtr{cee{gt{x

description: Several docks sit side by side along the western fringes of the
shoreline, where Deepwater Harbor drops deep into the sea, offering
her use to even the largest of seafaring vessels.  Few other places in
the realms offer such a diverse harbor.  There are few others able to
moor the great naval ships of Waterdeep, or the mighty trading barges
of Sembia.  There is scarcely any order among the chaos, as deckhands
unload ship after ship, passengers disembark to the city's more
hospitable locales, and crewmen form lines to forfeit months at sea.
The Dock Street continues along the harbor coast of Waterdeep.
20718.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: bard only
mob here who will transfer person to college of Olamn
20996.name: {RUNUSED

description: This little shop is less than perfectly maintained.  Its windows
are cracked and dirty, and the floors are unswept and dusty.
Nevertheless, the wares in the showcases and wall mounts attract many
to the insides of this unremarkable shop.  The showcase and three tall
floor-to-ceiling set of shelves are filled with incredibly fine
silverware.  Nearly anything made of silver can be found here, from
silverware to tea sets, daggers to trophies, or even headresses and
bustiers of silvermail!
20684.name: {BK{cr{8ab{Bbe{8ll{co{Br {WSi{8lv{Wer{wsm{ci{wths{x

description: {x
Waterdeep is a booming metropolis rivaled by few other cities in all of
Faerun and only by the technological city of Torregiano west across the
Sea of Swords. Here along its most prominent street, the full feel of a
densely populated city can be felt. The High Road is wide, greater than
four coaches across, yet scarcely is there place to walk it during peak
hours in the day.  Many people representing the majority of civil races
and of all walks of life can be encountered here at anytime making this
also an area where one can expand contacts and learn more about culture.
Waterdeep is traditional yet among the most tolerant cities anyone will
run across, having in place numerous laws banning racial discrimination,
and promoting religious tolerance to all but the most extreme religions.{x
20611.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: Delzorin Street continues through the temple district, passing by a
modest tower to the south devoted to Lady Luck.  Many stylish temples
line the streets, some more contemporary than others in various
styles.  The road is paved of dark stone, bordering the ornate, and
worn to a dull shine by many years of foottraffic.  Here, carts and
horses are discouraged as the religious sanctions in this district bar
excessive noises that are not directly related to worshi The street
continues east and west.
20943.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: Warrior's Way continues north and south, through some of
Waterdeep's more utilitarian offerings.  Most structures here are
basic wood and stone, butting closely against narrow sidewalks
fighting for precious space.  Materials prevent these buildings from
scaling to more than two or three stories, and so most leave little
room for alleyways or courtyards.  The narrow sidewalks are frequently
packed with people, and in places mercenaries are setup displaying
their skills in hopes of being bought along an adventure.  Much of the
foot traffic spills out into the street, so cart and horse traffic
slows considerably here, making Warrior's Way less used as a
thoroughfare than a place to inefficiently get from point A to point
B.
20895.name: {rW{Ra{wr{Wri{wo{Rr{r's {RW{Wa{wy{x

description: {1         T H E      W A T E R D E E P      D A I L Y      T R U M P E T{0
We serve to let the public know the truth! Find our newspaper around the city!
Here lies the most prominent - and truthful - newsgroup out in Waterdeep.
Unfortunately, due to their pursue of the truth, the building does not get
much support or help.  Large complex machinery line the walls and fill the
center of the room here with half printed broadsheets, fully edited
newspapers, and sketches and pictures of certain topics.  A large {ysign{x hangs
from the ceiling here as well, and screams for a visitor's attention.  As
the machines reel and spin, every hour of the day, a smell of ink and heated
broadsheet paper has consumed the building and all its inhabitants.  A fine
layer of dust has also accumulated on the old wooden floors.  This certainly
isn't the cleanliest of places, but it sure dishes out a nice newspaper.
20689.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: {x
Nearly every friendly, civilized race is represented in the crowds that
travel this road daily.  The High Road is a vital link within Waterdeep
and beyond, connecting trade routes as far north as Mirabar on the edge
of the Spine of the World. An influx of goods run through here each day,
from exotic foods, to high demand equipment and black market items, and
even mercenaries come through here, hoping to land some work. There are
many taverns and inns advertising off the road, though most locals will
say they are overpriced and lacking in hospitality, but rather the good
places to be are buried several blocks off this beaten path. Still, the
shops and businesses which set up along the road enjoy healthy revenues.
20781.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: A beautiful view of the countryside can be seen just to the east
and south, as the Cliffwatch opens Waterdeep on the eastern edge.
Here, many people come to enjoy the view and the dry breeze that the
inner continent brings in, as opposed to the sometime From this high
up, only birds and insects reach, and a magical ward prevents both
from being pests to the citizens of the city.  To the south, the walls
resume, joining with the walls of the City of the Dead, which is just
south of here.  Only fountains, benches and statues adorn this square,
as the unofficial ordinance is to keep the vendors at the bazaar.
20837.name: {rS{wuldow{rn {xat {cSa{ye{rrd{yo{cwn {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: The court here seems to be well kept for the small garden plots
along the road seem to be flourishing with beauty.  To the southwest
lies the entrance to a ornately designed palace which spires into the
sky.  The entrance is guarded by two knights, and you get the feeling
that they are indeed serious about their duty.  Just behind you to the
northwest lies another majestic building - a tower that eminates with
a dull red glow.  Waterdeep Way continues to the east while Fetlock
Court widens at the north.
20865.name: {cF{we{ctl{wo{cck {gCourt {xat {BWa{bt{8e{wr{8d{be{Bep {yWay{x

description: This short dirt road runs east to west connecting the docks to
snail street.  Not far to the west lie the docks that touch the great
sword coast, and the scent of the ocean is vividly accented here.  The
buildings here are old broken down shacks corroded with sand and salt.
Those that are in decent shape, but still quite raggy, are the
warehouses of the docks.  Just east of here runs the chaotic stretch
known as Snail Street.
20730.name: {cF{wis{ch {yStr{wee{yt{x

description: Julthoon street ends at the west wall, where it intersects a narrow
avenue that follows the wall north and south.  The seawatch tower can
be seen towering just to the northwest, overlooking the sea.  Here, a
large mural of a trade ship has been painted on the wall.  Large and
mostly mythical creatures appear to attack the ship on both sides, yet
the stern remains steadfast to the horizon, where the harbor of the
city be seen in the background.
20846.name: {RJulthoon{x at {MW{mest{Rw{rall {GS{gtr{cee{gt{x

description: The wide avenue continues north and south, intersecting with
another street that runs east of here.  At the corner, several trade
shops operate, suggesting this is an artisan's block of the city.  A
few banners hang from the tall buildings, advertising everything from
family crests, to new arrivals, bargain shopping and the gathering of
raiding parties to drive out northern trolls from the forests.
Several street lamps line the walkways, and littered about are benches
and drinking fountains to be used freely by the public.
20656.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: guildmaster here
20994.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: The buildings which line this street are tall, two story
juggernauts which overtake the small plots that each are built upon.
Some stone, many wood, and very few sport alleyways, as space is
precious in this old ward of the city.  The sidewalks are narrow, but
quaintly decorated with iron lamphooks and colorful plants.  Many
other lavish foliage hang from windows which sit open to the streets,
inviting the sounds from without.  The bustle here is sparse; people
walk about in a leisurely manner and generally this is one of the more
quiet areas in the city.  A small shop with many odd trinkets
displayed in the windows stands to the south.
20959.name: {WSk{8u{Wlls {wS{8treet{x

description: The deep grey bricks which pave the street begin to spread out in
a circular pattern as it accents this open air commons known as
Maiden's Square.  A few old wagon carts lie against the brick walls
holding displayed goods during the day for the adjacent shops of the
square.  To the north is an equipment shop, the east a clothing store,
and to the south is an ancient looking tower that looks as if it were
ready to crumble to pieces.  Vines and wild plant life grow all around
the tower, but the sturdy black iron gates forbid one to see much of
anything else.
20662.name: {WM{wa{yide{wn{W's {yS{8q{gua{8r{ye{x

description: Two large rusty gates stop your path southward.  Beyond the gate is an
overgrown courtyard.
{x
Tall, grey-stoned buildings dominate this section of the road, each one
peppered with many dark-paned windows.  Plants and other assorted items
are scattered about the many window sills, hinting that these buildings
are mainly used as living quarters for the middle class. The occasional
resident leans out of their window, watching the many people who travel
the road day in and day out. The High Road continues east to west while
another avenue designated Snail Street begins just to the south of here.{x
20797.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {cThough a large, open area was set aside for this Bazaar, it seems
not enough, as stalls sit lined side by side in great clumps and
people gather in great crowds about them.  The city watch is
everpresent here, though they prefer to stand outside of the Bazaar
circle and watch, which presents the opportunity for crime to occur
amidst the many distractions.  In many cases, the vendors are well
armed and there is little hesitation in taking the law into their own
hands if need be, despite there being strict laws in place for using
force against a wrong.  Here in the open market, things can quickly
get out of hand.{x
20914.name: {3Western Bazaar Market{0

description: This section of Soothsayer's Way is quite worn down since it runs
straight to Waterdeep Castle.  The buildings here are strictly
regulated, representing some of the most elaborate and decorative
displays of architecture in all the city.  To the west stands The
castle is built upwards on Mount Waterdeep and is visible at near
every vantage point in the city.  The ancient dungeons beneath flank
close behind, and to the side of the castle stands a derelict clock
tower stopped at the hour in which it failed.
20842.name: {mS{Moo{mths{Ma{myer's {BW{bay{x

description: This grand sized tavern, once looking very extravagant, is now beat and
scarred into from the many days and nights of arguments and brawl fights
that have come and passed.  At the north end of the tavern is a large bar
counter that takes up half of the room.  The other half of this sections of
the tavern is filled numerous table seatings for groups of all sizes.  The
bar counter and tables seem to look pretty crummy - mostly scarred, pitted,
and stained from who knows what.  Overall though, this is a pretty bustling
tavern, but most of the action takes place down a set of stairs in the back
where the games and entertainment stage lie.
20616.name: {WThe Sword's Rest{x

description: {6 This small and quaint store is cluttered with bottles of {7essential{6
{#oils{6, selective {8{8incense{6{6, and numerous types of dried materials.  A
light haze of burning {8incense{6 fills the room from floor to ceiling
giveing the shop a {^serene{6 and calming feel.  {0'
20700.name: Pelauvir's {yCounter{x

description: This street is finely paved in durable flat stones, most likely
pulled from the Dessarin.  They are cut and laid with care, having no
more than a finger's thickness between them.  Most are small stones,
no bigger than the size of an average human's head, and thus they
follow the contours of the road closely.  Heavy traffic has over the
years, upturned a few, which are periodically reset by the guild of
masons.  The Way of the Dragon cuts through several quaint shops and
residential buildings, all modest in style as this district is where
the commoners live.  To the north, a popular looking tavern is open
for business.
20642.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: Deep ruts carve their way into the rounded corners where to the
east this street merges with the great tradeway known as the High
Road.  Lying just off the main courseway, the Street of Smiths is a
popular sidestep for travelers looking to find some of Waterdeep's
classiest constructs.  Locals will warn however, that money and class
status is a decisive factor in seeing one's shop here, and while they
don't argue that everyone here is skilled, they will contest that
sometimes the skill found here is in the direction of deception rather
than craft talent.  The Street of Smiths continues westward, while to
the east runs the High Road.
20629.name: {wStr{8ee{wt {cof {WS{wm{8it{wh{Ws{x

description: {x
The crowds of people which travel this road are amazing for one who has
not been to a major city, and noteworthy for those who have.  Waterdeep
is the top of big cities, and though bigger crowds can be had elsewhere,
few other places can claim it a daily happening. Countless rows of tall
buildings can be found lining the roadway here taking on a plain square
look with shops operating out of lower levels and tenants living in the
higher floors. Here in the south ward one will find mostly local places
which cater to travelers along the main road. The Waterdhavians who are
caretakers to these businesses are friendly folk, though often too busy
to strike up extended conversation. For visitors to the city, along the
road is where much of the excitement can be found, as anything which is
marketable is here, and a hot meal and a cold drink is just up the road.
20606.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: The shop here is extremely clean and tidy.  Over four torches line each
wall of this store which makes it very bright - almost too bright.  Along
the walls where there aren't any torches though, are some of the most
gorgeous and intricately made paintings of the city of Waterdeep that you
have ever seen.  Each portrays a still life of some of the hot spots in the
city.  One painting is of the center square of Waterdeep, another of the
Hero's Garden, and another of Castle Waterdeep.  Due to all the wonderful
painting, one would think this building an art gallery, but it is not.  Up
at the counter here is a large pile of catalogues to all the sites and shops
in Waterdeep!
20701.name: {RUNUSED{X

description: This little shop has a split floor in the back, rising up three
steps to changing rooms and mirrored rooms for trying on new cloaks,
robes, and other garments.  The rest of the store is decorated very
nicely with many tones of color from the numerous types of clothing
available.  The floors, walls, and windows are sparkling clean, and
help give off a nice shine to the shop as torches and sun shed off
their light, reflecting in every part of the room.
20682.name: {MPiatran {RC{ml{Bothie{mr{Rs{x

description: telescope here
20707.name: {7O{8b{&s{8e{7r{&v{8a{&t{7o{8r{7y{0

description: The street curves here, going north and east.  The people who walk
by are varied in appearance, but most wear simple clothes and very
little in the way of jewelry or armament, signifying most as
commoners.  In fact, much of this place seems to be where the common
Waterdhaven resides, as evident by the plain buildings and densely
packed living spaces.  The street is nicely paved in thick stones well
worn by the heavy traffic.  As a main avenue of the city, the council
ensures that the Way of the Dragon paves a welcoming picture to the
city's coin laden visitors.
20640.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: The street continues around a few larger buildings, meandering
gently as it cuts through the Southern Ward.  Just to the west, the
sounds of mooring bells can be heard, as large ships pull into the
largest harbor on the western coast.  The air is cool and crisp, with
a hint of a salty mist lingering.  The local Waterdhavens busy
themselves with all manner of distractions: sitting along the shaded
entrance to an apartment complex, or pruning a tiny garden within a
split barrel, and a few are too busy with their destinations to
consider much else but their stride.  The look of these buildings is
typical of a commoner class, as this Ward is known by few, but lived
in by many.
20646.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: The streets are relatively quiet in this district, unlike the rest
of the city where day or night there are things happening.  Faint
music can be heard from an open window of one of the many lavish
villas which line both sides of Sulmor Street.  It is accompanied by
the sounds of laughter and conversation--most likely a party and one
that has a very exclusive guest list.  A few people walk the streets,
a cart and some horses, but otherwise traffic here is light.  In fact,
using these residential runs is regulated, no by Waterdeep code, but
by the gold coins which the nobles line the city watch's pockets with,
to ensure peace and quiet.  Strangers and would be trouble makers are
frowned upon here, and scarcely do they get far without questioning.
20978.name: {yS{wulmo{yr {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: This lavishly designed inn is obviously one of high expense.  The walls
have all been intricately made into tile murals which probably took over two
years total to make.  The tables have been fashionably designed straight
from pure glass, and the illumination for the inn is emitted by a dozen or
so, flashy lanterns hanging from the ceiling.  A counter to the east, which
looks to be solid oak, has been sanded down and stained a golden brown to
give it a richness in look.
20838.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: The main hall that you now stand within is immensely large.  In fact,
it's porportions inside match no where close to the way it looks from
outside.  {^Magic{0 is at work here, and indeed it should be since a large
plaque on the floor denotes this place owned by wizards.  There are no
torches or mounts for them in the grand hall, but somehow it has a glow of
light that eminates from the tower's {8smooth marble walls{0.  Most of this hall
is empty except for a coat rack to the right, and a long {1red{0 velvet rug that
travels around the plaque on the floor and up along a spiraling stairwell
going up.  The velvet rug has been intricately trimmed with {#golden {3lace{0, and
on the beginning face of the rug someone has written in big bold letters
"{#TRESPASSERS ARE BANISHED!{0"
20705.name: {5Kolat Towers{0

description: {w
Standing at the cast iron gates of Waterdeep, the northern plains call
out as the wind blows the tall grass and brings up the occasional dust
cloud from the dirt road that merges into Waterdeep City--the famously
vast High Road of song and lore. To the south stand majestic buildings
fit for kings in some lands but are merely noble manors in a city such
as this. The occasional cart or wagon can be seen entering and exiting
the city, some filled to the top and strapped about with trading goods
while others sparsely loaded down as it embarks on the quest back home
after a successful day at the Market Bazaar, in the center of the City.{x
20979.name: Within the {CG{cate{Cs {8of {BWa{bt{8e{wr{8d{be{Bep {8- {RN{rorthgate{x

description: Upon looking inside this large house, a soft shine glitters off the
metal wares that clutter the walls.  All types of armor pieces adorn
the walls, from metal boots to gauntlets to helms of splendid quality.
The house itself is a modest building, constructed of thick, roughed
timbers and it is barely recognizable as a headquarters for a guild.
20766.name: The {8Me{7t{8al {7Ho{8u{7se{$ of Wonders{0

description: Diamond Street opens up widely to the north to a vista of a vast
garden built about the square.  More round than square, the garden
houses many lush greenery and plenty of benches, lamps and color which
makes it inviting to the senses.  The buildings along either side of
the road diminish in height from two to one story, almost bowing in
patronage to the garden which stands just north of here.  To the west
stands an elegant temple, somewhat impractical but abounding in
beauty.
20633.name: {WD{Yi{wa{Wm{Yo{wn{Wd {YS{wt{Wr{Ye{we{Wt{x at the {BH{Ye{Wro{Ye{Bs' {GG{ga{yrd{ge{yn{x

description: {x
The High Road veers to the east and north here as the great temple of
the Plinth and its worship grounds lie to the south.  The grounds are
small, but the temple itself is a massive structure--a narrow pyramid
rising high into the sky, its apex cut to form a flat roof.  Numerous
people gather along the open common area where neutral ground permits
the worship of all deities. Along the High Road, many shops, inns and
taverns can be seen as this part of the city is known as the place to
be for commerce. Though city ordinance prohibits any trade within the
temple complex, vendors stretch their boundaries as far as is allowed.{x
20790.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: The hustle and bustle of the central bazaar rings throughout the
streets and alleys, as Sul Street makes it way due north through the
Sea Ward.  The rather plain buildings which line Julthoon and the
bazaar slowly morph into elegant masterworks of architecture, with
fleured eaves and elaborate waterspouts.  These are the characteristic
temple architecture prevalent in this ward, whether it is religious or
political in nature, all have adopted a wildly lavish style all their
own.
20982.name: {YSul {yStreet{x

description: Looming above, attached to the ceiling is a large sign that reads
"Boats Sold Here".  A large check in and check out desk is in the far
back of this room where a pre-set quill in ink has been prepared for
any signature bindings for people who decide to rent a boat or buy.
The wooden walls here seem to have white crusty covering to them that
looks like it might be some kind of powdered salt that has drifted
from the oceanic water of the Great Harbor of Waterdeep.
20769.name: {YS{yhip{ww{8right{x's {mRental {BHouse{x

description: This brightly illuminated shop is lined with shelving along each
wall with dozens of small square cubby holes built into each.  Hanging
out and cluttering these holes in a very sloppy manner are literally
thousands of scrolls, books, and papers on maps and sites from around
the world.  There is one large desk here in the center of the room
which is cluttered with many papers and a compass.
20685.name: {BL{baran's {CCa{crt{8og{wr{8ap{che{Crs{x

description: The homes which line both sides of the street are built as much for
practicality as they are for show.  Windows facing west are heavily
barred and some are double and triple paned due to the fierce sea
storms which blow in during the winter months.  Truly important, and
sometimes self-important, people come here to build their homes,
despite the limited months at which this ward is hospitable.  The Sea
Ward has for them a special allure of wealth and power.  Diamond
street intersects with Dolphin to the east and to the west it meets up
with the wall and the gates out to the sea.
20934.name: {WD{Yi{wa{Wm{Yo{wn{Wd {YS{wt{Wr{Ye{we{Wt{x

description: Warrior's Way reforms here, heading south through most of the city
and north it melds and ends with the Bazaar.  Tall stone structures
line either side of the street, hanging with long banners and flags.
The sidewalks are narrow and cluttered with old wagons and
decorations, not being one of the major through routes in the city.
There are also numerous wood structures, not seen as much further
north of here, as the change of classes begins to take hold.  Just a
little north of this spot can be heard the loud sounds of the Bazaar,
while east there appears to be a lock smithy set up for business.
20896.name: {rW{Ra{wr{Wri{wo{Rr{r's {RW{Wa{wy{x

description: The street continues around a few larger buildings, meandering
gently as it cuts through the Southern Ward.  Just to the west, the
sounds of mooring bells can be heard, as large ships pull into the
largest harbor on the western coast.  The air is cool and crisp, with
a hint of a salty mist lingering.  The local Waterdhavens busy
themselves with all manner of distractions: sitting along the shaded
entrance to an apartment complex, or pruning a tiny garden within a
split barrel, and a few are too busy with their destinations to
consider much else but their stride.  The look of these buildings is
typical of a commoner class, as this Ward is known by few, but lived
in by many.  To the east stands a bustling tavern, where many locals
go for drinks and conversation.
20697.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description: This is the private chambers of the Kolat Wizards.  The room here is
completely pitch black, except for the illumination that your light source
emits.  This room is completely bare, only leaving the smooth marble walls
and a cold echo throughout the tower.  Two doors are located on the east and
west walls which both have markings of runes and wards.  The spiral stairway
continues up as well to where you can see some natural light.
20706.name: {5Kolat Chambers{0

description: {yThe stables are made of wood, lined row after row in stalls where
the coach riders prepare their shifts.  Stacks of hay sit at the
entrance, where a wood and iron gate swings open, creating a makeshift
fence between each stable unit.  Several stable hands scurry to keep
the hay and water stocked, while keeping drivers happy and the horse
manure at a minimum.  A small, makeshift counter has been built at the
far end, where the stables also do business, contracting out riders
and selling their surplus of horses and supplies.  {x
20869.name: {YStables{x

description: Coach Street is constantly being patched as the heavy coach traffic
takes its toll on the poorly built surface.  Unlike major roads
through Waterdeep, this street was never built for heavy wheeled
traffic, and so significant effort is devoted to its upkeep.  Many of
the buildings here are simple, two or three story dwellings, many once
belonging to prominent families in the early days of Waterdeep's
history.  Many of these homes still retain their quaint exteriors,
though class shifts have since seen these converted to communal
dwellings were as many as 30 Waterdhavians live and interact.  A few
businesses operate along the street, but those are not commonplace.
Coach Street continues east and west.
20676.name: {BC{boa{Bch Str{bee{Bt{x

description: {6This vast, large open space is the market center of the city.
Temporary carts and stalls enclose this area in a maze of shops and
stores that hustle and bustle to sell and buy as much as they can each
day and night.  Even special cast iron lamposts have been placed
randomly around the Bazaar to illuminate the area when the sun sets
and leaves from the sky.  {0
20912.name: {3Northwest Bazaar Market{0

description: Dock Street ends here, as mountainous terrain stops the impending
growth of buildings abruptly at the base of Mount Waterdeep.  Below
and to the west is a small harbor commonly referred to as Smuggler's
Dock.  To the south within the harbor is an enclosing where many large
ships are moored.  This is the Naval Dock of Waterdeep, and is
strictly off limits for vessel or airfarer.  The Old Temple Lot lies
to the north, while Dock Street runs east from here along the many
rows of docks.
20818.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: Specifically to help Conwei get his rocks off... er... I mean,
to make items that vary to sell in his shop.
{x
(Needed for prog 20606)
20688.name: Conwei GOTO Loading Room

description: Wall Way begins here, as Sleeper's Walk leads to the south gates
of the City of the Dead.  This street follows the path of the walls
that separate the graveyard from the inhabitable city, and set along
its likes are many shops and peddlers who do business where they can.
Between the street and the wall are many small vendor stalls that
serve to cheapen and in some respects disrespect the memory of the
dead here.  Nonetheless, trade flourishes here, as it cannot be
stopped short of an order from the king or a decree from the secretive
lords.  No such decree has yet been issued.
20819.name: {8Wall Way{x

description: Before you lies the castle of Waterdeep, the cast iron gates that protect
it's inner sanctum looks as big as a mountain itself.  The thick iron bars
are wider than an elephant's leg, and probably could not even be bent by the
strongest of titans.  Guards stand guard here attentively, watching
everyone's move suspciously.  The crest of waterdeep found on the guards'
shields match the crests depicted on the rapidly waving flags staked high
atop the towers of this great castle.  To the west lies the great courtyard
of waterdeep castle, while east takes you away, back onto soothsayer's path.
20847.name: {BBefore {cC{Ca{Wst{Cl{ce {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
The wide, bustling road known as the High Road traverses Waterdeep City
north and south here. To the east is a narrow street, almost too narrow
for conventional cart and horse traffic. Very few people are seen going
in its direction, and it seems as if some almost try to avoid it. A big
wooden sign hangs from the corner of a building noting this side street
as the Coffinmarch - the march of the deceased being led to their grave.
20808.name: Intersection of {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x and {RCo{rff{8inm{rar{Rch{x

description: The main street veers north as it encounters a beautiful tower just
to the west, while heading due east further into the city.  The west
tower is a spiraling form, reminiscent of the luck trinkets children
wear about their necks.  A wall lies to the west, elegantly adorned
with coin-shaped bricks, and fading, metallic foil that once brought
luster to the masonry.  To the south, Sul Street begins, leading down
here to the main bazaar of Waterdeep.  The street begins clean and
ornate, and transforms into a utilitarian slab where commerce and
traffic ensues.
20944.name: {cD{Ce{clz{wo{cr{Ci{cn {WStr{wee{Wt{x

description: The street continues east and west here, following a narrow stretch
of lots to the south which are squeezed between this street and the
walls to the graveyard ward.  Restrictions in building near the City
of the Dead has limited the utility of the southern lots.  Most
buildings there are one story squats, used either as rental properties
or storage.  To the north is a drastic change, as tall, elegant villas
begin to spring up and fight for dominance.  Here at the southern half
of the north ward is but a taste of the obscene wealth of these
villas--usually the less wealthy nobles or ones with "new money" build
or reside here, in an attempt to put their foot in the door for more
lucrative accomidations up the road.
20831.name: {rS{wuldow{rn {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: This narrow alleyway connects Sleeper's Walk with the Court of the
White Bull.  A common throughway for adventurers, there are no open
entryways along the sides of the alley, but plenty of dark nooks and
crevasses for shady dealings to take place.  Loud sounds from the open
court to the east can be heard echoing between the buildings.
20936.name: {cC{8helor {rAlley{x

description: Slut Street continues here, being only slightly larger than an
alley that runs to the east.  The road is poorly paved in packed dirt
and scattered cobblestones, melded together with loose gravel that
seems to be piled back on the ruts from time to time.  Tall buildings
tower on either side of the street, but it is their backs which are
turned this way, as trash barrels and waste water trickle out into the
street.  A few stray animals linger about, but otherwise not a lot of
sights are worth mentioning here.
20752.name: {RS{yl{cu{yt {wSt{8r{cee{wt{x

description: Several docks sit side by side along the western fringes of the
shoreline, where Deepwater Harbor drops deep into the sea, offering
her use to even the largest of seafaring vessels.  Few other places in
the realms offer such a diverse harbor.  There are few others able to
moor the great naval ships of Waterdeep, or the mighty trading barges
of Sembia.  There is scarcely any order among the chaos, as deckhands
unload ship after ship, passengers disembark to the city's more
hospitable locales, and crewmen form lines to forfeit months at sea.
The Dock Street continues along the harbor coast of Waterdeep.
20722.name: {GD{yo{cc{gk {gStr{cee{gt{x

description: {x
Tall, grey-stoned buildings dominate this section of the road, each one
peppered with many dark-paned windows.  Plants and other assorted items
are scattered about the many window sills, hinting that these buildings
are mainly used as living quarters for the middle class. The occasional
resident leans out of their window, watching the many people who travel
the road day in and day out. The High Road continues on north and south.
20805.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: A near perfect view of the countryside can be seen here, to the
east where the city of Waterdeep is naturally protected by a 100-foot
cliff.  Named the Cliffwatch, this small stretch of unobstructed
perimeter is the only part of the city not protected by a wall, though
two large towers at either end prevent intrusions from the sky, or
attempts at land.  When the fog drifts in from harbor, seeing the
cliff's edge can be difficult, and so the entirety of the cliff edge
is protected by a short, 3 foot wired wall, which does little more
than stop an average human from just walking off to their doom.
Still, stories of jumpers or fallers are common here, whether it be
suicides, accidents or premeditated acts made to look like the former
two.  The city watch investigates any and all incidents, and
Cliffwatch is heavily patrolled.
20839.name: {cSa{ye{rrd{yo{cwn{x {WS{wtree{Wt{x

description: Two large iron gates stand closed here with guards of the watch posted
to uphold Waterdeep's ordinance that no one be allowed within the City
of the Dead after hours. The gates are blackened iron, reddened with a
layer of rust in patches and secured upon two massive stone pillars on
which are carved the likeness of skulls and bones. The wall around the
City of the Dead is tall and crowned with iron spikes, deterring those
who would seek to break the curfew. The walk continues south from here.{x
20816.name: The {rSouth {WGates {xto the {8C{ri{8ty of the {8D{re{8ad{x

description: {x
The High Road continues north and south through Waterdeep, here ongoing
on a long stretch of wide, bustling street.  Being the widest street in
the whole City of Spendors, some of the most impressive buildings stand
about the road.  Jutting out from seemingly every brick and stone are a
myriad of signs and banners beckoning patrons to whatever establishment
each represents. Just to the east is a tall, flamboyant shop displaying
all manner of costumes and bright colored clothing. Various dark alleys
line either side of the road, leading into the lesser known underground.
20806.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: {x
Along both sides of the street stand the many prominent homes of this
city's elite and wealthy.  They stand just out of reach of the common
man, behind tall, ornate walls topped with wrought iron work and many
intricately carved statuettes that depict everything ranging from the
busts of promiment members of society to legendary creatures that are
both fanciful and dangerous. These are themed per each villa that the
decorations line. Common to all is a seemingly carefree exhibition of
styles that prefer form over function and all exemplify utmost wealth.
20853.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: The sounds of chatter, and music fill you ears upon entering this popular
festhall that has been tinted black to make it eternally {8night{0.  People are
crowded in every part of the building, no matter what time of day.  A large
stage encompasses the whole southern side of the festhall here, and many
chairs and tables have been moved by the customers to swarm around it,
waiting for performance after performance.  Over to the east is a large bar
counter where many people can be seen gossiping and exchaning information,
but all i good cheer.  Above the bar counter is a large sign that depicts
the mark of this famous hall - three {&g{7li{&tt{7erin{&g{0 pearls.
20777.name: {8Three {&Pearls {8Nightclub{0

description: These boots look to be some kind of trophy from a contest.  An
inscription under the boots reads "For making the most reliable, and
beautiful boots ever, we thank you Thentavva"
This tiny shop has been interiorly designed to house three shelves both
on the east and west walls where many assortments of footwear can be put on
display and sold.  A very recognizable smell of tanned leather fills the
shop, as well as the polish used on leather boots that need a rejuvination
of their look.  On the counter to the south a pair of leather riding boots
have been bronzed as a trophy for some occasion.
20836.name: Thentavva's Boots

description: This grand equipment shop is suprisingly organized and well kept despite
the numerous odds and ends of adventuring equipment it holds.  Everything on
the shelves and displays are sparkling clean and most likely dusted daily.
At the back of the shop, there are a noticeable amount of chairs and stools
that seemed to be used for small gatherings of people to sit and chat with
the owner Essimuth.  All in all, this shop has a soft, pleasant glow to it
and welcomes any kind of passing adventurer.
20681.name: {8E{wss{8i{cm{Cut{ch's {cE{8qu{ci{rp{cm{8en{ct{x

description: Some of the most lavish architecture in all the city reside along
this street, its name as solemn and inviting as the clean sidewalks
and majestic temple complexes that seems to call out for worshippers.
Spires, and gables of noble villas are sporadically placed along with
temples devoted to the some of the more popular gods and goddesses of
Faerun.  The structures have an air of stateliness and majesty, and
the variety of building details are astounding.
20927.name: {yS{wtr{8ee{yt {xof the {MS{gi{Gngi{gn{Mg {CDolphin{x

description: This east west street is an icon of stature in Waterdeep,
exhibiting beautifully cut stones for paving, and ornate buildings
crowned in elaborate decorations that seem like they were painted just
yesterday.  The buildings along both sides of the street are tall and
seemingly new, fabricated mostly of stone with lower levels serving as
businesses and upper levels as residential lofts.  An exceptionally
beautiful house is to the north, built upon a raised terrace and
walled in with ornate stone and wrought iron wall.  The black stones
of this house contrast sharply with the buildings around it.
20630.name: {wStr{8ee{wt {cof {WS{wm{8it{wh{Ws{x

description: Several shops are setup along this northern stretch of the
Warrior's Way, as the avenue opens up to a vast open market further
north.  There are less battle-inclined things to see here, with more
general stores and even a few residential buildings strewn cluster of
timber and stone structures.  The streets are paved in fine
cobblestone--worn with age and bowing down the center from cart
traffic, where puddles gather and birds bask and bathe.  Colorful
flags and banners reach out into the streets, advertising patriotism
for fellow Waterdhavens, or the new smith opening up on the corner.
The diversity gives way to blending in.  Warrior's Way continues north
and south.
20894.name: {rW{Ra{wr{Wri{wo{Rr{r's {RW{Wa{wy{x

description: {x
The road continues north and south, cutting through several residential
districts here in the south ward. The fast moving wagons and horses add
to the precariousness of traveling this route which serves double roles
as a connecting route for Waterdhavians in their daily routine and as a
major trade road connecting cities all over the Sword Coast.  There are
several inns, taverns and shops to be seen here and while discounts are
not their defining characteristic, good service and wide selections are.
For those seeking convenience, their path need not stray from this road,
as everything can be found alongside it.  Not far to the east stretches
the eastern Trollwall, a reminder of the haven this city serves for all
20607.name: {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x through {BWa{bt{8e{xr{8d{be{Bep{x

description: Immar Street continues east and west here, veering slightly
southward as it makes its way closer to the North Trollwall.  A line
of quaint villas stand built one against the other here.  Most notable
among them is a row of several conjoined homes to the south, made to
look like miniature castles, with crenelations, banners, and high,
arched windows deeply set to give the illusion that they are open to
air.  Several gargoyles are set along the corners and the front
entrance, almost lifelike in appearance.  A paved pathway leads south
to the front of this villa, and the gates are open.
20830.name: {8Immar {wStr{8ee{wt{x

description: The street here is well worn, but also well maintained, as the
coaches make their main run north throughout the city.  On either side
of the street are buildings, stacked so close that scarcely there
remains an alley.  While helping to keep crime down, the lack of any
side thoroughfares makes traffic here somewhat congested, and
moderately dangerous for the pedestrian.  It is important to note that
Waterdeep law does not necessarily protect the pedestrian--oftentimes
a local commoner run down by a speeding coach rider will lose a
dispute because the coach owner is a member of a high ranking family
of nobility.  As such it is every person for themselves in this fast
paced city.
20645.name: The {YW{yay {8of the {RD{rr{yag{ro{Rn{x

description:
{mJoram{C winks your way as you glance at him.  He seems to be a
cheerful sort, and tends to his job with pride.  He motions you to
address the {Rmenu{C and awaits to take your order.  
{x
20600.room_name: The Barkeep is here, polishing a shot glass and taking drink orders.

description:
He's average height for a gnome, though a little plump. He wears all
manner of gadgetry about him, cementing the idea that he is a tinker
much like many other gnomes in these realms. He doesn't have a large
selection of goods like the other vendors, but rather only a select few
items which he rotates on a daily basis both to stimulate demand for
his unique goods, as well as to offset dwindling supplies. He has a reputation
for offering some very nice items fit for adventuring.
20601.room_name: {wA short, {Mplump {gg{yn{gome{w stands here, sometimes selling things, sometimes not.{x

description:
Pelauvir looks back at you as you glance at him.  His rosy red
cheeks become brighter with embarassment as you stare, but he holds
his posture just as firm.  Looking him over you notice that is a very
large....and round halfling.
20602.room_name: A short and {5plump{0 man is here, smiling at you with {1rosy{0 cheeks.
20602.name: Pelauvir, the store owner~

description:
Glancing over Hawkund you see a strong and forboding figure.  While
he may graying with age, his body is still in tip top shape, and his
firm muscles bulg through his shirt.  The stains of soot and ash cover
his hands, as it would any man of the forge.
20603.room_name: A tall, burly man is here with scars from years on the forge.
20603.name: {RUNUSED{x~

description:
This mysterious figure is difficult to assess. He (if it truly is as
he) is short, quick in movements but stealthy in posture, almost a sly
quality about him. You would quickly class him as a thief if no other
indications were given.
20604.room_name: A {rhooded {8rogue{x sneaks about the shadows here.
20604.name: a {rhooded {8rogue{x~

description:
The drunk reeks of alcohol, and looks as if he hasn't changed in
months.  His pants and shirt are ripped, and he grins at you greedily
in hopes of pawning a couple copper off of you.
20605.room_name: A drunk is here staggering about.
20605.name: a drunk~

description:
{8Perpetually watching, this gargoyle head has been carved with eyes
closed, inset atop the gates of this tower which rises high above.  An

features are still, void, and in a way it instills fear in those who
look upon it.  Locals who pass by do so with their eyes casted away

stone eyelids...  Something strange lies within this tower.  {x

description:
He is exceptionally short for a human, just a little tall for a
halfling.  He looks to be middle aged, he is bald and skinny.  He

that dangles from his shirt pocket.  He seems full of energy, spending

things, he is failing miserably.

He winks at you as you glance at him, and happily continues to

A very busy man looks up at you briefly, as he engulfs himself with
